Question: What will be the 12-month percentage change in the US Consumer Price Index (CPI) for September 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q3 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The US inflation rate fell slightly in April 2024 to about 3.4%, though still higher than the Federal Reserve's target of 2% (USA Today, Investopedia). The question will be suspended on 30 September 2024 and the outcome determined using the 12-month percentage change for September 2024 as first released by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) for "All items" as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected in October 2024 (FRED, click "EDIT GRAPH" and change "Units" to "Percent Change from Year Ago"). As of the launch of this question, the change for September 2023 was 3.69406%.
choices: Up by less than 1.200% or down
Up by at least 1.200%, but less than 1.800%
Up by at least 1.800%, but less than 2.400%
Up by at least 2.400%, but less than 3.000%
Up by at least 3.000%, but less than 3.600%
Up at least 3.600%, but less than 4.200%
target: Up by at least 2.400%, but less than 3.000%

Question: If Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) ground forces invade the Gaza Strip before 7 November 2023, when will Israel publicly announce or acknowledge that IDF ground forces have left the Gaza Strip?
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said that those responsible for the early October attacks in southern Israel will "will pay an unprecedented price" as Israel mobilizes forces near the Gaza Strip (Times of Israel, AP). For the purposes of this question, "invade" means the sending of armed forces into Gaza and holding territory (i.e., mere "raids" alone would not count).
choices: IDF ground forces will not invade the Gaza Strip before 7 November 2023

Question: When will Brazil's court-imposed ban on "X" operating in the country be fully lifted?
Description: On 30 August 2024, a Minister (i.e., Justice) of Brazil's Federal Supreme Court ordered "the immediate and complete suspension of the operation of X, formerly Twitter, throughout the national territory until the Court's judicial decisions are complied with and the fines applied are paid" after the company defied demands that it name a legal representative in the country (Supreme Federal Court of Brazil [in Portuguese, quotation translated by Google], Axios, NPR).

Question: Will Israel publicly announce the beginning of a ceasefire in the whole Gaza Strip before 7 October 2024?
Description: As Israeli military operations in the Gaza Strip continue, the prospect of an escalation between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon is further complicating the situation (Middle East Eye, CNN). Whether the ceasefire (i.e., a cessation of all hostilities) is unilateral or part of an agreement between belligerents is immaterial, and whether the ceasefire holds for its intended duration is immaterial. Conditional announcements (e.g., if all hostages are released) will not count.

Question: Will Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado be detained or arrested by Venezuelan authorities before 5 October 2024?
Description: Machado has continued to push for protests against the Maduro government, which has reportedly ordered her arrest (BBC, CNN, MercoPress, El País). The duration of a detention or arrest is immaterial so long as Machado is in the custody (i.e., being physically held or controlled) of Venezuelan authorities for some period of time. An attempt to detain or arrest Machado that results in Machado's death will count.

Question: What will be the lowest reported Arctic sea ice extent in 2024 as of 4 October 2024?
Description: Arctic sea ice extent, a measure of the ocean area in the northern hemisphere that is at least 15% sea ice, has trended down in past decades (NOAA). The question will be suspended on 3 October 2024 and the outcome determined using graph data as provided by the National Snow & Ice Data Center's (NSIDC's) "Charctic Interactive Sea Ice Graph" at approximately 5:00PM ET on 4 October 2024 (Charctic Interactive Sea Ice Graph, click "Arctic" on the left side above the graph, About Charctic Data). Other site data is immaterial. As of the launch of this question, the lowest daily reported Arctic sea ice extent in 2023 was 4.230 million sq. km on 19 September.
choices: At least 3.4 million sq. km, but less than 3.8 million sq. km
At least 3.8 million sq. km, but less than 4.2 million sq. km
At least 4.2 million sq. km, but less than 4.6 million sq. km
At least 4.6 million sq. km, but less than 5.0 million sq. km
At least 5.0 million sq. km, but less than 5.4 million sq. km
target: At least 4.2 million sq. km, but less than 4.6 million sq. km

Question: What will be the value of the FAO Food Price Index for September 2024?
Description: Global food prices fell overall in 2023, with the exceptions of sugar (highest since 2011) and rice (up 21% last year) (Economist, AP). The question will be suspended on 30 September 2024 and the outcome determined using nominal data reported by the FAO for September 2024, expected in early October 2024 (FAO, see table near bottom of page). As of launch, the value for the Food Price Index for September 2023 was 121.9. To download historical nominal data, click "Excel: Nominal and real indices from 1990 onwards (monthly and annual)" under "Download datasets."

Question: When will US total nonfarm payrolls next decrease in a given month as compared to the preceding month?
Description: The US labor market continued to add jobs in September 2023 despite ongoing fears that rising interest rates will slow hiring (CNBC, US News & World Report). The question will be suspended on 30 September 2024 if still open and the outcome determined using BLS data as first reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data database (FRED) (FRED, click "EDIT GRAPH" and change "Units" to "Change, Thousands of Persons"). Subsequent revisions would be immaterial.

Question: What will be the US civilian unemployment rate (U3) for September 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q3 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The US unemployment rate has remained near historic lows in the Spring of 2024 despite multidecade highs in interest rates (CNN, AP). The question will be suspended on 30 September 2024 and the outcome determined using the Bureau of Labor Statistics' official civilian unemployment rate (U3) as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database when first released, expected in October 2024 (FRED).

Question: When will all work stoppages (either strikes or lockouts) involving the International Longshoremen’s Association (ILA) union and the US Maritime Alliance (USMX) cease?
Description: On 1 October 2024, the ILA began a strike impacting US ports from Maine to Texas, impacting billions of dollars of commerce per day (AP, CNBC). The US Chamber of Commerce has called on President Biden to invoke the Taft-Hartley Act to prevent the strike, but Biden has stated that he will not intervene (US Chamber of Commerce, CBS News). A strike will be considered to have ceased as of the date and time the ILA announces the strike has ended or will end, not necessarily when employees return to work (e.g., if the ILA announces on a Monday that the strike will end on the following Tuesday, the question will close as of Tuesday). If the strike pauses or ends due to Taft-Hartley being invoked, the strike will be considered to have ceased as of the date and time its invocation takes effect.

Question: When will the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) invade Lebanon with tanks and/or armored vehicles?
Description: As fighting in Gaza continues, concerns remain that there may be a major escalation of fighting between Israel and Iran-backed Hezbollah in Lebanon (AP, BBC, France 24). For the purposes of this question, the IDF will be deemed to have invaded Lebanon if its forces, including ten or more tanks and/or armored vehicles, cross the "Blue Line" into Lebanon and remain in Lebanon for more than 36 hours (UN Interim Force in Lebanon, Britannica - Armoured Vehicle). Whether the IDF has invaded Lebanon will be determined using credible open-source media reporting. The question will close retroactively as of the beginning of the IDF invasion of Lebanon.

Description: High levels of natural gas in storage in the US has kept its price relatively low in historical terms (Oil Price, EIA - Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report). The question will be suspended on 29 September 2024 and the outcome determined using the spot price per million British thermal units (BTUs) per the US Energy Information Administration (EIA) as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected in October 2024 (FRED, EIA - British thermal units). On 21 May 2024, the spot price for natural gas was $2.52.

Question: What will be the yield for US 10-year Treasury securities on 30 September 2024?

Description: The yield (or interest rate) of the 10-year Treasury is a major benchmark for finance in the US (Investopedia). Question: Will Russian President Vladimir Putin attend the inauguration of the next Mexican president, scheduled for 1 October 2024?
Description: Mexico has invited Putin to attend the inauguration of Mexican President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum (Texas Public Radio, TASS). Putin's potential attendance would be complicated by the issuance of a warrant for his arrest by the International Criminal Court, which obliges Mexico to arrest Putin should he enter the country (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, Parliamentarians for Global Action). Putin must be physically present at the inauguration to count, which is scheduled for 1 October 2024 (AP).

Question: Will Nicolás Maduro attend the inauguration of the next Mexican president, scheduled for 1 October 2024?
Description: Mexico has invited Venezuelan President Maduro to attend the inauguration of Mexican President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum as Venezuela is gripped by protests and international scrutiny amid widespread claims of fraud (Pinnacle Gazette, NPR). Maduro must be physically present at the inauguration to count, which is scheduled for 1 October 2024 (AP).

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in September 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 29 September 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of September 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with an "9" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in September 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 100.70, 117.08, 82.78, 94.55, and 98.84. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: Will a Quad country or the People's Republic of China publicly accuse the other of using a weapon against its national military, militia, and/or law enforcement forces before 1 October 2024?
Description: The Quad countries are the US, India, Japan, and Australia (Council on Foreign Relations). Tensions continue in the South China Sea and elsewhere, with increasing fears of some form of military confrontation (Voice of America, GIS). For the purposes of this question, drones may be considered part of "forces" if so claimed by the accused. Accusations of "warning shots" being fired would count (e.g., guns or missiles). An accusation of a vessel or aircraft deliberately ramming another would count, but accidental collisions would not. Cyberattacks and the use of directed-energy weapons (e.g., microwaves, sonic weapons) would not count, and an accusation of the mere use of blunt instruments as weapons, such as clubs and fists, in hand-to-hand fighting would not count. An accusation by one Quad country against another Quad country would not count, and both the accused use and the accusation must occur during the question's open period to count.

Question: Will Chad join the Alliance of Sahel States ("L'Alliance des États du Sahel" in French, or AES) before 1 October 2024?
Description: Burkina Faso, Mali, and Niger formed the AES in September 2023 as a mutual defense pact among the military-controlled countries (France 24, AP). Chad and Mauritania took steps in December 2023 to dissolve an older security alliance, the G5 Sahel, after Burkina Faso, Mali, and Niger withdrew from that group (Al Jazeera, Critical Threats). A public announcement from the government of Chad that it has joined the AES will count. Chad signing an instrument of membership to the AES will count, irrespective of when Chad's membership would take effect. Some form of subordinate membership (e.g., observer status) will not count.

Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q3 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: As of early May 2024, Grayscale Bitcoin Trust's exchange-traded fund (ETF) was one of the best performing ETFs of 2024 (US News & World Report). The question will be suspended on 29 September 2024 and the outcome determined using Coinbase price data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED). On 26 May 2024, the price of a bitcoin was $68,474.60.

Question: What will be the price of Ethereum on 30 September 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q3 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: On 23 May 2024, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) made a rule change that would enable for an Ethereum (aka Ether) exchange-traded fund (ETF), which led to a jump in the cryptocurrency's value (CNBC, Crypto.news). The question will be suspended on 29 September 2024 and the outcome determined using Coinbase price data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED). On 26 May 2024, the price of one Ethereum was $3,821.14.

Question: When will Russia and Ukraine sign or announce an agreement to end the current conflict in Ukraine?
Description: Russia's war in Ukraine continues, though Russia floated the idea of talks on the "post-conflict settlement" of the war in October 2023 (Economist, Newsweek, Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty). A signed or announced agreement must be acknowledged by both Russia and Ukraine to count. The Ukrainian government as recognized by the European Union must be party to the agreement to count. An armistice or a ceasefire of indefinite duration would count and must include the whole of Ukraine. Time-limited agreements (e.g., 72-hour ceasefire) would not count. The date an agreement would take effect is immaterial.

Question: Will China, Russia, and/or the US detonate a nuclear device in their respective territories before 1 October 2024?
Description: As global tensions rise among nuclear powers, observers are concerned about the prospect of renewed nuclear weapons testing and a new arms race (Economist, AP, Politico, Arms Control Association). For the purposes of this question, a "nuclear device" is one that is designed to produce a nuclear explosion utilizing the fission and/or fusion of nuclear fuel (e.g., Uranium-235, lithium deuteride). A radiological device (aka "dirty bomb") would not count (Nuclear Regulatory Commission). Whether China, Russia, and/or the US has detonated a nuclear device in their respective territories will be determined using credible open source reporting. A detonation by China, Russia, or the US must occur within that country's internationally recognized boundaries (including territorial waters and airspace) to count.

Question: Will Nikol Pashinyan cease to be the prime minister of Armenia before 1 October 2024?
Description: Fallout from Azerbaijan's September 2023 conquest of Nagorno-Karabakh, a region in Azerbaijan with an ethnic Armenian majority, continues to put heavy pressure on Armenia's government (Economist, AP, Politico). Pashinyan staying on in a caretaker prime minister role subsequent with his resignation as prime minister would still count as Pashinyan ceasing to be prime minister (Constitution of Armenia, see Article 149, France24).

Question: When will a new parliamentary election be called in Canada?
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is expected to seek another term, but if and when new elections will be called remains up in the air (Economist, CBC). For early elections to be called, the Governor General, usually at the request of the prime minister, must dissolve parliament and issue election writs (Elections Canada, Edmonton Journal, Canadian Gazette - Proclamation Dissolving Parliament, Canadian Gazette - Proclamation Issuing Election Writs). The date an early election is to be held is immaterial, and the calling of a by-election would not count (Elections Canada).

Question: What will be the closing value of the S&P 500 Index on 30 September 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q3 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The S&P 500 Index is one of the most followed indices for equity markets in the world (Investopedia - S&P 500). The question will be suspended on 29 September 2024 and the outcome determined using data from S&P as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED).

Question: Will there be a lethal confrontation between the national military forces, militia, and/or law enforcement personnel of Taiwan and the People's Republic of China (PRC) before 1 October 2024?
Description: The PRC has continued military activities around Taiwan throughout 2023 (Al Jazeera, Council on Foreign Relations, BBC). A lethal confrontation is one that results in one fatality for the national military forces, militia, and/or law enforcement of either side.

Question: How many of the largest commercial banks in the US will fail between 29 September 2023 and 30 September 2024?
Description: The failures of Silicon Valley Bank, Signature Bank, and First Republic Bank shook the financial system in the beginning of 2023, and concerns over more potential turmoil remain (FDIC - Bank Failures in Brief, CNN, Guardian, CNBC). The question will be suspended on 30 September 2024 and the outcome determined using data available from the Federal Reserve and open-source reporting. For the purposes of this question, "the largest commercial banks in the US" are those listed in the Federal Reserve's list of "Large Commercial Banks" as of 30 June 2023 (Federal Reserve - Large Commercial Banks, see "June 30, 2023"). A bank will be deemed to have failed if it files for bankruptcy, is taken over by the FDIC, or similar outcome (e.g., FDIC). The acquisition of a distressed bank by other institutions alone would not count (e.g., Federal Reserve - Wachovia).

Question: What will be total regular season attendance at Major League Baseball (MLB) games in 2024?
Description: In 2023, total attendance at MLB games exceeded 70 million for the first time since 2017 (MLB, Yahoo Sports). The question will be suspended on 29 September 2024, when the regular season is scheduled to conclude, and the outcome determined using data as reported by Baseball Reference (Baseball Reference, see "Attendance" column, MLB - 2024 Schedule).
choices: At least 64 million, but fewer than 67 million
At least 67 million, but fewer than 70 million
At least 70 million, but fewer than 73 million
At least 73 million, but fewer than 76 million
At least 76 million, but fewer than 79 million
target: At least 70 million, but fewer than 73 million

Question: How many National League Major League Baseball (MLB) teams will lose 100 or more games in the 2024 regular season?
Description: In the 2024 MLB season, all baseball teams are divided into one of six divisions, with three divisions in the American League (AL) and three in the National League (NL) (Sports Interaction). In the 2023 regular season, one NL team lost 100 or more games: the Colorado Rockies with 103 (MLB - 2023 Standings). The regular season is scheduled to conclude on 29 September 2024 (MLB - 2024 Schedule). If the number of games played by all teams in the regular season is changed for any reason, the threshold will not be adjusted.

Question: Before 28 September 2024, will the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) schedule a worker's election on unionization for the Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Alabama (HMMA) plant?
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union has been campaigning to unionize various foreign auto manufacturer facilities in the US, including the HMMA plant in Montgomery, Alabama (Korea Economic Daily, WSFA, AL.com). The question will close early upon an NLRB-sponsored election on union representation being held for the HMMA employees (suspended on the last day of the election), and an election announced before 28 September 2024 but scheduled to be held after 28 September 2024 will count and the closing date will be adjusted accordingly. The outcome will be determined based on the outcome of the election as first reported, irrespective of subsequent appeals as to the election.
choices: Yes, and the workers will vote in the affirmative for unionization
Yes, but the workers will not vote in the affirmative for unionization

Question: When will Boeing Starliner astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore safely return to Earth?
Description: As of the launch of this question, two US astronauts, Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, remain stranded on the International Space Station (ISS) as NASA evaluates various problems with their Boeing Starliner spacecraft (Newsweek, France 24, Space.com). To safely return, the crew must return to Earth alive. If an attempted return to Earth fails for either or both astronauts, the question will close "Not before 27 September 2024" as of the date of the failed attempt.
choices: Before 16 August 2024, with both together using the Starliner spacecraft used to launch them to the ISS
Between 16 August 2024 and 29 August 2024, with both together using the Starliner spacecraft used to launch them to the ISS
Between 30 August 2024 and 12 September 2024, with both together using the Starliner spacecraft used to launch them to the ISS
Between 13 September 2024 and 26 September 2024, with both together using the Starliner spacecraft used to launch them to the ISS
Before 16 August 2024, with both together using a different spacecraft
Between 16 August 2024 and 29 August 2024, with both together using a different spacecraft
Between 30 August 2024 and 12 September 2024, with both together using a different spacecraft
Between 13 September 2024 and 26 September 2024, with both together using a different spacecraft
Before 27 September 2024, the astronauts will safely return to Earth separately

Question: Who will Japan's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) elect as its next president to replace Fumio Kishida?
Description: Prime Minister Kishida unexpectedly announced that he would not seek reelection as the president of the LDP, which paves the way for the party to pick a new leader who will be the next presumptive prime minister (AP, NPR, ABC News).
choices: The LDP will not elect a new president before 9 November 2024

Description: With NCAA women's basketball superstar Caitlin Clark entering the WNBA in 2024, interest in the women's basketball league is expected to rise (NBC Chicago, AP). Question: Before 21 September 2024, will Judge Aileen Cannon cease to be the judge presiding over Donald Trump's federal classified documents criminal case in the Southern District of Florida before a trial?
Description: While a grand jury indicted Trump in June 2023, the exact timing of the trial remains up in the air as Special Prosecutor Jack Smith expresses dissatisfaction with Judge Cannon's handling of the case (The Hill, CNN, NBC News, Lawfare - Trump Prosecuted in the Southern District of Florida). Being removed as judge in the case by order of a pertinent court (e.g., 11th Circuit Court of Appeals) will count, irrespective of any subsequent appeals. The question will close upon the swearing in of a jury in case of a jury trial or the swearing in of the first witness in case of a bench trial (Cornell - Jeopardy).

Question: Which Major League Baseball team will win the National League Central Division in the 2024 season?
Description: The outcome will be determined using the division standings as reported by Major League Baseball once the regular season has concluded, scheduled for 29 September 2024 (MLB - Standings, MLB - 2024 Schedule).

Question: Before 8 November 2024, will the Federal Reserve announce a change in the US federal funds rate target range?
Description: As the US economy has remained resilient in the beginning of 2024, rate cut expectations for the Federal Reserve this year have fallen (US News & World Report, Yahoo [Bloomberg]). Some market participants are pondering the chances of a rate increase (MSN [MarketWatch]). Conditional announcements (e.g., if the labor market deteriorates, if inflation falls) would not count, and the date a cut would take effect is immaterial. The last time the Federal Reserve announced an increase to the US federal funds rate was 26 July 2023, with the last time it announced a cut being 15 March 2020 (Federal Reserve - FOMC Statement 26 July 2023, Federal Reserve - FOMC Statement 15 March 2020). If still open, the question will close as of the Federal Reserve releasing its FOMC statement as scheduled for 7 November 2024.

Question: Will the Federal Reserve announce a reduction in the upper limit of the Federal Reserve's target range for the federal funds rate before close of business on 18 September 2024?
Description: Expectations for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in the near future have risen as inflation and the US labor market have cooled (AP, US News & World Report, NY Post). Conditional announcements (e.g., if the labor market deteriorates, if inflation falls) would not count, and the date a cut would take effect is immaterial. The last time the Federal Reserve announced a cut to the US federal funds target range was 15 March 2020 (Federal Reserve).
choices: Yes, a reduction of 0.25% or less
Yes, a reduction of more than 0.25%, but no more than 0.50%
Yes, a reduction of more than 0.50%
target: Yes, a reduction of more than 0.25%, but no more than 0.50%

Question: What will be the Federal Reserve's median projection for the federal funds rate for the end of 2024 in its September 2024 projection materials?
Description: In the Federal Reserve's projection materials released on 12 June 2024, the median projection for the federal funds rate for 2024 (specifically, "value of the midpoint of the projected appropriate target range for the federal funds rate or the projected appropriate target level for the federal funds rate at the end of the specified calendar year") was 5.1%, up from the 4.6% projection released in March 2024 (Federal Reserve - FOMC Projection Materials June 2024, see "Table 1"). The question will be suspended on 17 September 2024 and the outcome determined using the next projection materials released by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), expected on the second day of its two-day meeting scheduled for 17-18 September 2024 (Federal Reserve).

Question: What will be the Federal Reserve's median projection for the federal funds rate for 2025 in its September 2024 projection materials?
Description: In the Federal Reserve's projection materials released on 12 June 2024, the median projection for the federal funds rate for 2025 (specifically, "value of the midpoint of the projected appropriate target range for the federal funds rate or the projected appropriate target level for the federal funds rate at the end of the specified calendar year") was 4.1%, up from the 3.9% projection released in March 2024 (Federal Reserve - FOMC Projection Materials June 2024, see "Table 1," Investopedia). The question will be suspended on 17 September 2024 and the outcome determined using the next projection materials released by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), expected on the second day of its two-day meeting scheduled for 17-18 September 2024 (Federal Reserve).

Question: At close of business on 18 September 2024, will the upper limit of the Federal Reserve's target range for the federal funds rate be lower, the same, or higher than it was at close of business on 31 July 2024?
Description: The US federal funds rate is the interest rate charged for overnight lending among financial institutions with accounts at the Federal Reserve and sets the base rate for borrowing costs across the financial system (Federal Reserve). The target range for the federal funds rate is set by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). Its September meeting is scheduled for 17-18 September 2024.

Question: Which EU Member State's commissioner-designate will Ursula von der Leyen first nominate to be assigned the European Commission's (EC's) Directorate-General for Competition?
Description: After being reelected by the European Parliament (EP) to again lead the EC, Ursula von der Leyen is tasked with assigning commissioners from all EU Member States with certain responsibilities, sometimes called portfolios (European Commission, Euronews, Politico - 25 July 2024, Politico - 23 May 2024, Competition Directorate-General). In 2019, she introduced her proposed team in September (European Commission - Press Release 10 September 2019, Politico). Whether the EP gives its consent to the commissioner is immaterial. If von der Leyen doesn't nominate a commissioner-designate before1 November 2024, the close date will be extended. If von der Leyen ceases to be the president-elect of the EC, the nomination by her replacement will count.

Question: Which EU Member State's commissioner-designate will Ursula von der Leyen first nominate to be assigned the European Commission's (EC's) Directorate-General for Climate Action?
Description: After being reelected by the European Parliament (EP) to again lead the EC, Ursula von der Leyen is tasked with assigning commissioners from all EU Member States with certain responsibilities, sometimes called portfolios (European Commission, Euronews, Politico - 25 July 2024, Politico - 23 May 2024, Climate Action Directorate-General). In 2019, she introduced her proposed team in September (European Commission - Press Release 10 September 2019, Politico). Whether the EP gives its consent to the commissioner is immaterial. If von der Leyen doesn't nominate a commissioner-designate before1 November 2024, the close date will be extended. If von der Leyen ceases to be the president-elect of the EC, the nomination by her replacement will count.

Question: Will Deutsche Bahn announce an agreement to sell its subsidiary DB Schenker before 1 January 2025?
Description: In December 2023, Deutsche Bahn, Germany's state-owned national rail operator, announced that it would try to sell its logistics unit, DB Schenker (US News & World Report, Deutsche Bahn - DB Schenker Logistics, DW). Deutsche Bahn is reportedly looking to sign a contract for the sale in the second half of 2024 (Yahoo). In the event that a new entity or joint venture agrees to buy DB Schenker, it would be considered acquired by the entity listed as an answer if that entity or its subsidiary owns a controlling share (i.e., more than 50%) of the acquiring entity. If two or more UAE entities have a controlling share combined, the question will close "Yes, a UAE entity or entities (e.g., DP World, Abu Dhabi Ports)." Acquisition by a wholly-owned subsidiary of an entity listed would count for that entity. Whether the transaction is completed is immaterial. The question will close early if Deutsche Bahn officially announces that it is no longer going to sell DB Schenker.
choices: Yes, to Maersk (A.P. Moller - Maersk A/S)
Yes, to a UAE entity or entities (e.g., DP World, Abu Dhabi Ports)
Yes, to UPS (United Parcel Service, Inc.)
Yes, to another entity or entities

Question: Will David Calhoun cease to be the sole CEO of Boeing before 1 December 2024?

Additional problems at the company have since arisen (CNN, MSN, Yahoo). The addition of a co-CEO would count, and Calhoun's status as president of Boeing is immaterial.

Question: Who will the governor of New Jersey appoint to fill the US Senate vacancy to be left by Senator Bob Menendez?
Description: Senator Bob Menendez, who was convicted on various charges related to corruption in July 2024, announced that he would resign his US Senate seat effective 20 August 2024, leaving the task for appointing a replacement to finish Menendez's term to New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy (CNN, Newsweek, Patch). Phil Murphy's wife Tammy, who initially ran for the Democratic Party nomination for November's election for the seat, has reportedly taken her name out of consideration (New Jersey Globe). The Senate is expected to reconvene after its August recess on 9 September 2024 (US Senate - Tentative 2024 Schedule).
choices: No one will be appointed to fill a vacancy for Bob Menendez' Senate seat before 9 September 2024

Question: When will the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) invade Lebanon with tanks and/or armored vehicles?
Description: As fighting in Gaza continues, concerns remain that there may be a major escalation of fighting between Israel and Iran-backed Hezbollah in Lebanon (Yahoo, Al Arabiya, ABC News). For the purposes of this question, the IDF will be deemed to have invaded Lebanon if its forces, including ten or more tanks and/or armored vehicles, cross the "Blue Line" into Lebanon and remain in Lebanon for more than 36 hours (UN Interim Force in Lebanon, Britannica - Armoured Vehicle). Whether the IDF has invaded Lebanon will be determined using credible open-source media reporting. The question will close retroactively as of the beginning of the IDF invasion of Lebanon.

Question: When will Egypt officially allow Palestinian refugees from the Gaza Strip who are not foreign nationals of a UN member state to enter Egypt?
Description: As Israel's offensive in Gaza focuses in the south of Gaza near the Egyptian border, concerns grow and contingencies are being considered for a potential refugee crisis (Yahoo, NPR, US News & World Report). Opening its border for individualized circumstances (e.g., medical evacuations, employees of specific organizations, family members of particular persons) alone would not count. Allowing refugees to enter Egypt in order to continue on to a different location would count. An announcement alone without evidence that Palestinians have actually crossed into Egypt would not count, and allowing refugees who entered Egypt from Gaza without authorization to stay or go on to another location would not count.

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in August 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 30 August 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of August 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with an "8" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in August 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 91.84, 68.94, 98.85, 82.28, and 91.62. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: When will the yield curve for 2-year and 10-year US Treasury bonds next cease to be inverted?
Description: When interest rates on longer-term debt drop below rates on shorter-term debt, the yield curve is said to invert, which has often historically been a signal of an approaching recession (Investopedia - Yield Curve). The curve for 2-year and 10-year Treasury bonds inverted in July 2022 (NBC News). The outcome will be determined using daily US Treasury Department data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database for "10-Year Treasury Constant Maturity Minus 2-Year Treasury Constant Maturity" (FRED). The yield curve will be considered to have ceased to be inverted if 2-year and 10-year bond yields are reported as equal for a given day (i.e., 0.00 as reported by FRED).

Question: When will Srettha Thavisin cease to be the prime minister of Thailand?
Description: Srettha was appointed prime minister as a political compromise more than three months after the 2023 Thai general election (Bangkok, CNN, France 24). Thailand has seen two military coups in the past 17 years (Refworld, European Parliament - Thailand: from coup to crisis).

Question: Between 24 July 2024 and 11 August 2024, will there be a terrorist attack in continental France or French Polynesia resulting in at least three fatalities?
Description: As the 2024 Summer Olympics approach in France, security concerns are running high (NBC News, El País, ASIS International, Olympics - Paris 2024 Schedule). The surfing competition will take place in Tahiti, which is in French Polynesia (Olympics - Surfing). For the purposes of this question, "terrorism" is as defined by EU law (European Council, see "EU definition of terrorism"). Fatalities must occur during the question's duration to count, and attribution or claims of responsibility are immaterial. "Continental France" includes the territory of the French Republic on the continent of Europe plus the island of Corsica. The hijacking or bombing of an aircraft will count if the aircraft last took flight from continental France/French Polynesia or fatalities occur within the territory or airspace of continental France/French Polynesia. An attack in the territorial waters of continental France/French Polynesia will count.

Question: Where will France rank among countries in total medals in the 2024 Summer Olympics?
Description: Paris is scheduled to host the 2024 Summer Olympics, and France is hoping to finish in the top five in the medal count (Inside the Games). As of December 2023, Nielsen's Gracenote Virtual Medal Table forecast had France winning 54 medals total, which would put it in fifth place behind (in order) the US, China, Great Britain, and Japan (Infobae, Nielsen - Virtual Medal Table). The Paris 2024 Olympic Games are scheduled for 26 July through 11 August 2024 (Paris 2024). In the event of a tie, rank will be determined first by the total number of gold medals, then total silver medals, then total bronze medals. If a tie still exists, then the question will close with the rank with which France is tied with another country or countries. For the purposes of this question, delegations from countries would count as countries (e.g., NBC Chicago).

Question: When will North Korea next detonate a nuclear device?
Description: Amid an flurry of ballistic missile tests in 2023, there are concerns that North Korea may test another nuclear weapon (NBC News, Al Jazeera). North Korea's most recent nuclear detonation was in 2017 (BBC).

Question: How many gold medals will China win in the 2024 Olympics?
Description: China is expected to be a top competitor at the 2024 Paris Olympics, though its image has been tarnished by a new doping scandal (NBC New York, AP). The 2024 Paris Olympics are scheduled for 26 July through 11 August 2024 (Olympics.com). Whether an athlete is stripped of a medal after the conclusion of the 2024 Olympics is immaterial.

Question: How many gold medals will the United States win in Athletics events, which includes track and field events, at the 2024 Olympics?
Description: Athletics events generally include running, jumping, and throwing events (NBC). At the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, the US won 7 gold medals, down from 13 in the 2016 Olympics (Olympedia, set "By sport" to "AT - Athletics" and "By Games" to the pertinent year). Athletics events are scheduled for 1-11 August 2024 (Olympics.com).

Question: Which country will win the 2024 Olympic gold medal in women's football (soccer)?
Description: The Women's Gold Medal Match is scheduled for 10 August 2024 (Olympics.com).

Description: On 13 February 2024, the US House of Representatives narrowly voted to impeach Mayorkas for "willful and systemic refusal to comply with the law" and "breach of public trust" related to border security (ABC News, Congress.gov - Mayorkas Articles of Impeachment). The Constitution requires a two-thirds vote for a conviction (US Senate - Impeachment).

Question: Will the Men's Marathon Swimming competition take place in the River Seine at the 2024 Olympics?
Description: France invested heavily to make the River Seine safe to use for certain swimming competitions, but E. coli levels remained elevated as of July 2024 (ESPN, ABC News). The men's competition is scheduled for 9 August 2024 (Olympics - Marathon Swimming Schedule). The question will close as of the event commencing with athletes swimming in the river, though the question would close early if use of the river is officially canceled or the event is postponed to a date after 11 August 2024.

Question: What percentage of US credit card balances will be in serious delinquency in the second quarter of 2024?
Description: Credit card debt reached a record $1.13 trillion in the fourth quarter of 2023, with the percentage of that debt moving into "serious delinquency" (i.e., 90 or more days delinquent) up 59% versus the fourth quarter of 2022 (New York Fed, ABC News, CNBC). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data as reported by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York (NY Fed) in its Q2 2024 Household Debt and Credit Report, expected in August 2024 (New York Fed, click "DOWNLOADS" and select "DATA" to download the file). In its Q4 2023 report (see the "CC" column in the "Page 12 Data" sheet), the NY Fed reported the "Percent of Balance 90+ Days Delinquent" for credit cards at 9.74%.

Question: Before 1 December 2024, will former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont publicly return to Spain?
Description: Pedro Sánchez was reelected as Spain's prime minister on 16 November 2023 after agreeing to push for a generally unpopular amnesty deal for Catalan separatists, including exiled leader Charles Puigdemont (AP, Guardian, France 24). For a return to Spain to count, Puigdemont's presence in Spain must be publicly known, and entering and leaving the country without it being publicly known that he's in the country would not count (Antena 3 [in Spanish]). Whether Puigdemont returns voluntarily is immaterial.

As of the launch of this question, Biden's approval rating on 21 June 2024 was 39.5%. The data for 2 August 2024 will be accessed for resolution at approximately 5:00PM ET on 7 August 2024.

Description: On 21 July 2024, President Joe Biden announced that he would no longer seek reelection (X - Joe Biden, Politico). If no vice presidential candidate has been nominated by the Democratic Party before 23 August 2024, the close date will be extended.

Question: Before 21 September 2024, will the Supreme Court grant either a stay or injunctive relief against the State of New York related to the state's conviction or sentencing of Donald Trump?
Description: On 3 July 2024, Missouri filed a lawsuit with the US Supreme Court against New York for "violating Missourians’ First Amendment right to hear from a presidential candidate in the 2024 presidential election" (Missouri Attorney General, The Hill, Supreme Court Docket - Missouri v. New York). On 12 July 2024, the Supreme Court gave New York until 24 July 2024 to file responses (Supreme Court Order - 12 July 2024). A stay or any form of injunction will count, including as to gag orders (Cornell - Stay, Cornell - Injunction). The question will close early if the Supreme Court denies Missouri's motion for a bill of complaint or otherwise dismisses the proceedings initiated by Missouri (Congress.gov - US Constitution Article III, §2, Clause 1 Annotated).

Question: When will the yield curve for 2-year and 10-year US Treasury bonds next cease to be inverted?
Description: When interest rates on longer-term debt drop below rates on shorter-term debt, the yield curve is said to invert, which has often historically been a signal of an approaching recession (Investopedia, CNBC). The curve for 2-year and 10-year Treasury bonds inverted in July 2022 (NBC News). The outcome will be determined using daily US Treasury Department data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database for "10-Year Treasury Constant Maturity Minus 2-Year Treasury Constant Maturity" (FRED).

Question: Who will win the Democratic primary for Missouri's 1st Congressional District in 2024?
Description: Progressive "Squad" Representative Cori Bush is facing a major primary challenge from St. Louis prosecutor Wesley Bell (USA Today, Politico). The Democratic primary is scheduled for 6 August 2024 (Ballotpedia).

Question: Will Mike Rogers win the Republican primary for the US Senate election for Michigan in 2024?
Description: The race for the Republican nomination to try and flip the Michigan Senate seat being vacated by the retiring Debbie Stabenow includes former US Representatives Justin Amash, Peter Meijer, and Mike Rogers (NBC News). The Republican primary is scheduled for 6 August 2024 (Ballotpedia).
choices: Yes, and he will win more than 50.0% of the vote
Yes, but he will win 50.0% or less of the vote

A public announcement, letter of intent, or similar instrument would count, though a conditional announcement (e.g., Poland would join if country X does A, B, and C) alone would not count.

Question: How many gold medals will American swimmer Katie Ledecky win in the 2024 Olympics?
Description: Katie Ledecky, one of the most decorated swimmers in Olympics history, hopes to, among other things, become the first female swimmer to win the 800m freestyle four consecutive times with a gold in the 2024 Paris Olympics (NBC). Whether a medal is won in an individual or team event is immaterial. The final for the last event for which Ledecky has qualified is scheduled for 3 August 2024 (Olympics.com). Ledecky has qualified for five events, but is expected to only compete in four (NBC Los Angeles).

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in July 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 30 July 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of July 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with a "7" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in July 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 114.62, 89.19, 96.81, 85.07, and 82.80. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: Before 1 August 2024, will the United States publicly announce that it has deployed regular ground armed forces to Yemen for the stated purpose of fighting Houthi forces?
Description: As Houthi forces continue firing missiles and drones at commercial ships off the coast of Yemen, the US and allies may further escalate their role and presence in the country (US Dept. of Defense, Al-Monitor, Atlantic Council). For the purposes of this question, "Yemen" includes the boundaries generally recognized by the international community, and "regular" ground armed forces would include military forces not considered Special Forces (Britannica - Special Forces, e.g., Navy SEALs, Army "Delta Force"). The presence of ground forces evacuating nationals or based at diplomatic missions would not count, but the announced deployment of regular ground armed forces for the stated purpose of training forces in Yemen to fight Houthi forces would count. The question would close upon an announcement of the actual presence of armed forces on the ground, and the announcement of the deployment of forces for noncombat purposes (e.g., humanitarian relief, mine clearing from noncombat areas) would not count.

Question: At close of business on 31 July 2024, will the upper limit of the Federal Reserve's target range for the federal funds rate be lower, the same, or higher than it was at close of business on 12 June 2024?
Description: The US federal funds rate is the interest rate charged for overnight lending among financial institutions with accounts at the Federal Reserve and sets the base rate for borrowing costs across the financial system (Federal Reserve). The target range for the federal funds rate is set by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). Its July meeting is scheduled for 30-31 July 2024.

Question: When will the "land bridge" between Crimea and Russia be severed, according to the Institute for the Study of War (ISW)?
Description: In its fight against Russian forces, Ukraine hopes to sever the "land bridge" of occupied territory linking Crimea with Russia (Christian Science Monitor, NPR, Wall Street Journal, see slide 2 for a map of the land bridge). The outcome will be determined using data as provided by the Institute for the Study of War's (ISW's) interactive map of Russia's invasion of Ukraine (ISW). For the purposes of this question, "Crimea" means the territory on the Crimean Peninsula marked as "Russian-controlled before February 24, 2022" on the ISW map, and "Russia" means the border of Ukraine and Russia generally recognized by the international community. Question: How many total vessels will transit through the Suez Canal in the first calendar quarter of 2024?
Description: Various shipping firms have begun diverting traffic away from the Red Sea and bypassing the Suez Canal as Iranian-backed Houthi forces launch attacks against commercial vessels off the coast of Yemen (CNBC, MSN, Newsweek). In October 2023, the Suez Canal Authority announced increases in transit dues (i.e., tolls) for using the Suez Canal that are to take effect 15 January 2024 (Suez Canal Authority). The question will be suspended on 31 March 2024 and the outcome determined using fiscal year (FY) Q3 2023/2024 data (FY Q3 2023/2024 is the same as the first calendar quarter of 2024) as reported by the Central Bank of Egypt in its monthly statistical bulletin once FY Q3 2023/2024 are first reported, expected in April 2024 (Central Bank of Egypt). In its September 2023 Monthly Statistical Bulletin, the Central Bank of Egypt reported a total of 6,523 transits through the Suez Canal (Central Bank of Egypt - Monthly Statistical Bulletin September 2023, see "31/1 -Traffic in the Suez Canal" at the bottom of page 54 of 93 of the PDF; see "Number" under "Total" for "Q1" under 2023/2024, inforMARE). You may download consolidated historical data here: https://goodjudgment.io/docs/Suez_Canal_Total_Transits_Calendar_Q4_2018_-_Q3_2023_19_December_2023.xlsx.

Question: What will be the spot exchange rate value of the Chinese yuan renminbi to one US dollar on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The Federal Reserve releases daily bilateral exchange rate data on a weekly basis (Federal Reserve). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Federal Reserve data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected in early July 2024 (FRED). On 12 February 2024, the spot exchange rate value was 7.1928.

Question: How many total vehicles will Tesla deliver to customers in the second quarter of 2024?
Challenges_list: 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge
Description: Tesla missed delivery expectations in the first quarter of 2024 (CNBC, Electrek). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Tesla's Production & Delivery press release for Q2 2024, typically found under "Production & Delivery" (Tesla - Quarterly Results). Tesla's total vehicle deliveries in the first quarter of 2024 was 386,810 (Tesla - Production & Deliveries Q1 2024).This question is part of the 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge. Click here for more details.

Question: Will India lift its ban on the export of white rice from the country before 2 July 2024?
Description: India banned exports of non-basmati white rice in July 2023 as part of an effort to rein in food prices in the country, and they are expected by observers to stay in place through India's spring election cycle (CNBC, Ministry of Consumer Affairs, MSN, The Wire (India), Economic Times). A general lifting of the ban would count, irrespective of whether it is replaced by quotas or tariffs. Special exceptions to the ban (e.g., allowing the export of limited amounts of white rice for a specific destination) alone would not count, and the lifting of the ban must occur during the question's open period to count.

Question: What will be the yield for US 10-year Treasury securities on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The yield (or interest rate) of the 10-year Treasury is a major benchmark for finance in the US (Investopedia). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using US Treasury data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected the following week (FRED). On 12 February 2024, the yield was 4.17%.

Question: Between 29 September 2023 and 30 June 2024, will the UN Security Council increase the number of troops authorized in Somalia after 30 June 2024 under the mandate for the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS)?
Description: ATMIS, an African Union mission in Somalia there to support the fight against Al-Shabaab and other groups, was intended to withdraw in 4 phases (UN Security Council Resolution 2687 (2023), ATMIS, Amani Africa). As of the launch of this question, the Phase 3 withdrawal is due to be completed by the end of June 2024 (UN Security Council Resolution 2628 (2022), see §28). This follows phase 2 whose deadline was extended to the end of 2023 (Africa News). An increase in permitted personnel after June 2024 or an extension in time at higher numbers would count.

Question: In NetChoice, LLC v. Paxton, will the Supreme Court rule that the viewpoint-based censorship restrictions (Section 7) in Texas' social media censorship law (HB 20) complies with the First Amendment?
Description: The Supreme Court agreed to hear challenges to House Bill 20 (HB 20), a Texas law that, among other things, prohibits qualifying social media companies from censoring users based on the viewpoint of their expression (Economist, Texas.gov, Oyez, LegiScan - HB 20, see Section 7). The district court issued a preliminary injunction barring enforcement of the law, which the Fifth Circuit reversed and NetChoice appealed to the Supreme Court (SCOTUSblog, Politico, The Verge). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." If the Court rules that Section 7 facially complies with the First Amendment and/or "as applied" to all parties of the case, the question will close "Yes," regardless of the potential of other future challenges (Bona Law). The outcome of Moody v. NetChoice, LLC, a companion case out of Florida, is immaterial.

Question: Before 1 July 2024, will NATO or a NATO member state publicly accuse Russia of attacking a crewed, non-Ukrainian-flagged vessel in the Black Sea outside of Ukrainian and Russian territorial waters?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: As Russia's war in Ukraine grinds on, Ukraine has tried to restart trade via the Black Sea after the expiration of the Black Sea Grain Initiative in July 2023 (Yahoo, UN - Black Sea Grain Initiative, Farm Policy News). For the purposes of this question, "attacking" means striking a pertinent vessel with a weapon (e.g., bullets, missiles, but not fire hoses, throwing garbage, etc.) or deliberately ramming that vessel with another vessel.

Question: When will NATO and/or a NATO member state publicly accuse Republic of Serbia national military forces and/or law enforcement of either entering Kosovo without authorization or firing a weapon or weapons into Kosovo?
Description: Tensions in Kosovo have escalated in 2023, with ethnic Serb protesters clashing with NATO's KFOR peacekeeping forces in late May, a firefight between Kosovo law enforcement and ethnic Serb gunmen at an Orthodox monastery, and reports of forces of the Republic of Serbia amassing at the border (AP, France 24, BBC). The Republic of Serbia requested to deploy forces in Kosovo in December 2022, but KFOR declined (Politico). For the purposes of this question, "firing weapons into Kosovo" means the shooting of bullets, artillery shells, rockets, offensive drones, or other munitions into the territory or airspace of Kosovo. The entering of forces or firing of weapons and the accusation of such must take place in the question's open period to count.

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in June 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 29 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of June 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with a "6" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in June 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 136.30, 114.17, 119.32, 123.76, and 103.15. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: Before 1 July 2024, will the US, IAEA, and/or a UN agency publicly state that it believes it more likely than not that Iran possesses a nuclear weapon capable of being detonated?
Description: Various group continue to voice concern that Iran is developing a nuclear weapons capability (AP, US News & World Report). A public statement from a US military or federal agency would count. The testing or detonation of a nuclear device would not be necessary for resolution. A radiological device (aka "dirty bomb") would not count (Mass.gov). "Roughly even chance" or "roughly even odds" without an explicit statement that the probability is greater than 50% would not count. For further information on US intelligence community terminology on probabilities and confidence, see Intelligence Community Directive 203 (Federation of American Scientists).

Question: In Trump v. US, will the Supreme Court rule that Donald Trump is immune from prosecution in his appeal from the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia (DC Circuit)?
Description: On 28 February 2024, the Supreme Court agreed to hear Trump's appeal (Supremecourt.gov - Trump v. US Docket) from the DC Circuit's decision that he did not have presidential immunity from criminal prosecution for events related to the 6 January 2021 riot at the Capitol Building (SCOTUSblog, CBS News, The Hill, DC Circuit - US v. Trump). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law as to Trump and the criminal charges in place that gave rise to this case, the question will close as "No." A ruling that Trump has immunity for some, but not all, criminal charges at issue will not count.

Question: What will be the price of bitcoin on 30 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: Bitcoin was up nearly 30% in this year as of 27 February 2024 with more upside pressure as its next "halving" approaches (MarketWatch, CNBC). The question will be suspended on 29 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Coinbase price data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED). On 12 February 2024, the price of a bitcoin was $49,961.00.

Question: What will be the price of Ethereum on 30 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: Ethereum, the cryptocurrency second only to bitcoin in market capitalization as of February 2024, saw major gains in the beginning of 2024 amid anticipation of a "Dencun upgrade" and speculation about a possible Ethereum ETF (Yahoo, Unchained, Consensys). The question will be suspended on 29 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Coinbase price data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED). On 12 February 2024, the price of one Ethereum was $2,666.22.

Question: When will Russia and Ukraine sign or announce an agreement to end the current conflict in Ukraine?
Description: Amid reports and suggestions for peace talks between Russia and Ukraine, the war continues (AP, Anadolu Agency, NBC News). A signed or announced agreement must be acknowledged by both Russia and Ukraine to count. The Ukrainian government as recognized by the European Union must be party to the agreement to count. An armistice or a ceasefire of indefinite duration would count and must include the whole of the internationally recognized territory of Ukraine, including Donbas and Crimea. Time-limited agreements (e.g., 72-hour ceasefire) would not count. The date an agreement would take effect is immaterial.

Question: When will all military forces of the Russian Federation cease to be in the Luhansk and Donetsk Oblasts in Ukraine?
Description: Ukraine hopes to expel Russian forces from the whole of the country, though observers note that this will be difficult (Defense One). For the purposes of this question, "military forces of the Russian Federation" includes forces under the command of the Russian Ministry of Defence and military contractor groups (e.g., Wagner Group and Redut). The continued presence of "People's militias" associated with the Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics would be immaterial, as would the location of any prisoner of war. Ambiguous reporting regarding the presence of military forces of the Russian Federation will be ultimately decided using data and reporting provided by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW).

Question: Will there be a shutdown of the US federal government before 1 July 2024?
Description: Looming deadlines on 19 January 2024 and 2 February 2024 for different government functions could mark the first federal shutdown since December 2018 to January 2019 (Congressional Research Service, USA Today). For the purposes of this question, a "shutdown of the US federal government" would mean a ceasing of operations due to a lack of funding appropriation. A partial shutdown would count (Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget). As a reminder, this question is, by default, governed by dates in the Pacific Time Zone.

Question: Before 1 July 2024, will the Scottish Parliament vote in the affirmative for early elections?
Description: The push in Scotland for independence from the United Kingdom continues, with early Scottish Parliament elections suggested as a means toward that end by the independence-minded Scottish National Party (Yahoo UK, The National). Under the Scotland Act of 1998, the Scottish Parliament may dissolve itself and seek early elections if supported by a two-thirds majority, though some members of the Scottish Parliament (MSPs) have discussed attempting to do so with a simple majority bill (Legislation.gov.uk - Scotland Act, Section 3, The Scotsman, The National). In the story from "The National" in the preceding sentence, the "one-line bill to get around the Fixed-term Parliaments Act" refers to the Early Parliamentary General Election Act of 2019 (Legislation.gov.uk - Early Parliamentary General Election Act 2019, House of Commons Library). The question would close upon the announcement of results of a qualifying vote that would lead to early elections, irrespective of any judicial intervention, acts of the Parliament of the United Kingdom, and or Royal Assent. The Scottish Parliament will be deemed to have voted in the affirmative for early elections upon reaching the minimum threshold for passage under the purported legal authority invoked by the parliament (e.g., two-thirds under the terms of the Scotland Act, simple majority by means of legislation only requiring a simple majority).

Question: Will the World Health Organization (WHO) declare a new Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) before 1 July 2024?
Description: A PHEIC is defined by WHO as "an extraordinary event which is determined to constitute a public health risk to other States through the international spread of disease and to potentially require a coordinated international response" under International Health Regulations, with recent examples including COVID-19, Monkeypox, and wild polio (International Health Regulations 2005, linked here under publications - WHO - International Health Regulations, International Health Regulations - Annex II, Pan American Health Organization, NPR).

Question: Which cricket team will win the 2024 Men's T20 World Cup Final?
Description: The International Cricket Council's (ICC's) Men's T20 World Cup is scheduled to begin on 4 June 2024 in the US and West Indies, with the final scheduled for 30 June 2024 (Economist, T20 World Cup, Britannica - Twenty20 Cricket).

Question: In NY Times v. Microsoft/OpenAI, will a federal court issue any injunctive relief for the NY Times against any named defendant related to the use of its copyrighted materials to train large language models (LLMs) before 29 June 2024?
Description: On 27 December 2023, the New York Times Company (NY Times) filed a civil complaint in the US District Court for the Southern District of New York seeking, among other things, action by the court to prevent Microsoft and OpenAI from using its intellectual property to train LLMs like ChatGPT without compensation (AP, CNBC, NY Times v. Microsoft, et al.). Whether the relief takes the form of an injunction or restraining order is immaterial (Cornell - Injunctive Relief, Cornell - FRCP Rule 65). Injunctive relief as to the use of an LLM trained with NY Times' copyrighted material would count. Whether injunctive relief is stayed pending appeal is immaterial.

Question: Will former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro be arrested by public authorities before 29 June 2024?
Description: On 19 March 2024, a Brazilian federal police indictment against Bolsonaro was released by the country's Supreme Court, which included accusations of fraud related to whether he was vaccinated for COVID-19, though the decision whether to criminally charge him falls to the prosecutor-general's office (AP, Guardian, Yahoo). The ordering of Bolsonaro to house arrest with Bolsonaro's presence at the pertinent home confirmed will count. Brazilian airspace and territorial waters are considered to be "inside" Brazil. The jurisdiction served by public authorities who arrest Bolsonaro is immaterial.

Question: What will be the closing value of the S&P 500 Index on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The S&P 500 Index is one of the most followed indices for equity markets in the world (Investopedia - S&P 500). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data from S&P as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED).

Question: In Fischer v. United States, will the Supreme Court rule that 18 U.S.C. § 1512(c), which prohibits obstruction of congressional inquiries and investigations, can be used to prosecute Joseph Fischer for his actions in the riot at the US Capitol on 6 January 2021?
Description: Joseph Fischer and others were charged with crimes for their actions in the riot at the US Capitol Building on 6 January 2021 as Congress was tallying electoral votes, including a criminal charge for violating 18 U.S.C. § 1512(c) that concerns obstruction of congressional inquiries and investigations (SCOTUSblog). The District Court dismissed the charges made under 1512(c) against various defendants, deciding that the statute does not apply to the circumstances in the case (Casetext - US v. Miller (DC Circuit Court of Appeals), Lawfare). The DC Court of Appeals reversed the District Court, and the Supreme Court agreed to hear the case (Lawfare, CBS News). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." Any Supreme Court disposition of a case involving Edward Lang or Garret Miller will be immaterial.

Question: In Loper Bright Enterprises v. Raimondo, will the Supreme Court explicitly overrule Chevron U.S.A. v. Natural Resources Defense Council (Chevron), which requires courts to defer to federal agency interpretations of statutes?
Description: "Chevron deference" is among the most important principles in administrative law in the US, though it has faced a great deal of criticism (Cornell - Chevron Deference, Politico). Fishing companies, including Loper Bright Enterprises, sued the federal government over an administrative rule requiring them to help fund a monitoring program, and appealed to the Supreme Court after losing in both district and circuit courts (Oyez). The fishing companies have asked if Chevron should be overruled or clarified as to statutory silence on certain matters (SCOTUSblog, Holland & Knight). A mere clarification under the existing Chevron framework would not count. The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: In City of Grants Pass v. Johnson, will the Supreme Court rule that the City's enforcement of its ban on public camping against homeless people violated the Eighth Amendment's bar against cruel and unusual punishment?
Description: Grants Pass, Oregon, adopted various ordinances intended to prohibit people from sleeping or camping outside within city limits, which were challenged in a class action lawsuit filed on behalf of homeless people in the area (Oyez, SCOTUSblog). The district court ruled against the City and Ninth Circuit affirmed (Casetext - Johnson v. City of Grants Pass, Washington State Standard). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." If the Court rules that enforcement of the ban could violate the Eighth Amendment but did not as applied to the Respondents (i.e., the named class representatives), the question would close as "No."

Question: Will "Bronny" James be drafted in the 2024 NBA Draft?
Description: Bronny James, the son of NBA star LeBron James, announced in April 2024 that he would enter both the NBA draft and the NCAA transfer portal, and he was medically cleared for the draft in early May 2024 (ESPN, NBC News, 247 Sports). The 2024 NBA Draft is scheduled for 26-27 June 2024 (NBA). The question will close early if James withdraws from the draft and would be ineligible to re-enter.

Question: What will be the weekly average interest rate for 30-year fixed rate mortgages in the US for the week ending 27 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: Mortgage rates rose in early 2024 as markets tempered expectations of near-term Federal Reserve interest rate cuts (ABC News). The question will be suspended 26 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Freddie Mac 30-year fixed rate mortgage average data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED). For the week ending 29 June 2023, the weekly average interest rate for 30-year fixed-rate mortgages in the US was 6.71%.

Question: In Harrington v. Purdue Pharma L.P., will the Supreme Court rule that a bankruptcy court could approve OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma's reorganization plan, which includes nonconsensual, nondebtor releases?
Description: Purdue Pharma declared bankruptcy as it faced heavy liability for its role in the US opioid crisis, and agreed in a bankruptcy court to contribute billions of dollars in exchange for, among other things, a release from further civil liability for the Sackler family owners of the firm (AP, CNN, USA Today). A federal district court ruled that the bankruptcy court lacked the authority to approve a plan that included nonconsensual releases for third parties, which the Second Circuit reversed due to binding precedent (Oyez, SCOTUSblog, Second Circuit - In Re: Purdue Pharma (2023)). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: In Murthy v. Missouri, will the Supreme Court rule that any of the federal government's actions regarding social media content moderation violated the First Amendment?
Description: The Attorneys General of Louisiana and Missouri sued the federal government in 2022 claiming that different federal agencies were exerting unconstitutional influence over content moderation actions by various social media companies (KOMU, Oyez). After a Louisiana district court imposed a broad injunction against several agencies preventing them from contacting social media companies, the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals limited the reach of that injunction, and the Biden administration appealed to the Supreme Court (The Verge, AP, SCOTUSblog). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." A ruling that any particular action violated the First Amendment would count.

Question: In what place will Rep. Lauren Boebert come in the 2024 Republican primary for Colorado's 4th Congressional District?
Description: Facing stiff challenges in the congressional district she currently represents, Rep. Lauren Boebert announced for the 2024 US elections that she would run in Colorado's 4th Congressional District, where incumbent Rep. Ken Buck has decided not to seek reelection (CBS News, Post Independent, The Hill). The Republican primary is scheduled for 25 June 2024 (Ballotpedia). If Boebert does not appear on the ballot for whatever reason, the question will close "Fourth or lower." In the event of a tie for first place, the outcome will be determined based on the tie-breaking procedures used under Colorado state law (eBenchBook - CRS 1-11-101, see (3)).

Question: Which NHL hockey team will win the 2024 Stanley Cup Final?
Description: The 2023 Stanley Cup Final is scheduled for June 2024 (NHL Playoff, NHL - Standings).

Question: What will be the annualized rate of US housing starts for May 2024?
Description: The rate of housing starts, a measure of new home construction in the US, has trended down since May 2023 as interest rates price many potential homebuyers out of the market (US News & World Report, CNBC, Yahoo). The question will be suspended on 31 May 2024 and the outcome determined using data provided by the US Census Bureau as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database for May 2024, typically in June (FRED). As of the launch of this question, FRED reported that housing starts totaled 1.583 million in May 2023.
choices: More than 1.15 million but fewer than 1.30 million
More than 1.45 million but fewer than 1.60 million
target: More than 1.15 million but fewer than 1.30 million

Question: In Moore v. United States, will the Supreme Court rule that the Mandatory Repatriation Tax (MRT) is unconstitutional as to the Moores?
Description: Created by the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017, the MRT requires that taxes be paid on certain corporate earnings and profits from controlled foreign corporations (i.e., foreign corporations that are majority owned by US persons) (Casetext - Moore v US 9th Circuit, Tax Foundation). The Moores, investors in an Indian company, challenged the MRT as unconstitutional because it was, among other things, beyond the scope of income taxes permitted by the 16th Amendment to the US Constitution (Oyez). The outcome of the case may touch on the constitutional viability of a federal "wealth tax" in the US (ABC News, Bloomberg Tax). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: Will Serbia notify the Secretary General of the Council of Europe of its intention to withdraw from the organization before 18 June 2024?
Description: On 27 March 2024, a committee of the Council of Europe, a human rights organization, voted to recommend that Kosovo be granted membership (Balkan Insight, Council of Europe). Serbian President Aleksandar Vučić threatened to pull Serbia out of the Council of Europe if Kosovo is granted membership (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, Eunews). Per Article 7 of the Statute of the Council of Europe, a member "may withdraw by formally notifying the Secretary General of its intention to do so" (Statute of the Council of Europe).

Question: Which team will win the 2024 NBA Finals?
Description: The 2023-24 NBA Finals is scheduled to conclude no later than 20 June 2024 (NBA - Key Dates, NBA - Standings).

The film is scheduled to be released on 14 June 2024 (Hollywood Reporter).This question is part of the 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge. Click here for more details.
