Question: When will Marianne Williamson cease to be a candidate for the 2024 Democratic nomination for US president?
Description: After dropping out of the presidential race on 7 February 2024 and re-entering on 28 February 2024, Marianne Williamson is perhaps the biggest name challenging President Biden for the Democratic nomination since Dean Phillips dropped out on 6 March 2024 (Ballotpedia, Fox News, Axios). Examples of what will count for resolution of this question include an official announcement that Williamson no longer seeks the Democratic Party nomination for president or that she is fully suspending her campaign.

Question: What will be the annual inflation rate in Argentina in May 2024?
Description: As Argentine President Javier Milei begins to implement major reforms in the economically troubled country, already high inflation is expected to spike (Economist, AP, MSN, Yahoo). The question will be suspended on 31 May 2024 and the outcome determined using National Institute of Statistics and Censuses (Spanish: "Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos," or "INDEC") data as reported by Trading Economics (Trading Economics). Historical data may be downloaded from the INDEC website (INDEC [in Spanish], see download options under "Índice de precios al consumidor con cobertura nacional").

Question: Will Tesla shareholders vote on changing the company's state of incorporation from Delaware to Texas or elsewhere before 31 August 2024?
Description: On 30 January 2024, a decision out of Delaware's Court of Chancery voided Elon Musk's Tesla pay package, which prompted Musk to call for a shareholder vote to move Tesla's state of incorporation to Texas (Delaware Court of Chancery - Tornetta v. Musk, CNBC, Investopedia). The question will close early if there is a vote in the affirmative for the move, but not if there is a vote that is not in the affirmative for the move.
choices: Yes, and the vote will be in the affirmative for the move
Yes, but the vote will not be in the affirmative for the move
target: Yes, and the vote will be in the affirmative for the move

Question: Before 13 June 2024, will the Federal Reserve announce a cut in the US federal funds rate?
Challenges_list: Thinking Analytically in an Uncertain World — Harvard Kennedy School Challenge (2023)
City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: As the Federal Reserve has increased interest rates to combat inflation, there are concerns whether the US will be pushed into recession (Yahoo Finance, CNBC). Conditional announcements (e.g., if the labor market deteriorates, if inflation falls) would not count, and the date a cut would take effect is immaterial. The last time the Federal Reserve announced a cut to the US federal funds rate was 15 March 2020 (Federal Reserve).

Question: At close of business on 12 June 2024, will the upper limit of the Federal Reserve's target range for the federal funds rate be lower, the same, or higher than it was at close of business on 1 May 2024?
Description: The US federal funds rate is the interest rate charged for overnight lending among financial institutions with accounts at the Federal Reserve and sets the base rate for borrowing costs across the financial system (Federal Reserve). The target range for the federal funds rate is set by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). Its June meeting is scheduled for 11-12 June 2024.

Question: What will be the Federal Reserve's median projection for personal consumption expenditures (PCE) inflation for 2024 in its June 2024 projection materials?
Challenges_list: 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge
Description: In the Federal Reserve's projection materials released on 20 March 2024, the median projection for PCE inflation for 2024 (specifically, "percent changes from the fourth quarter of the previous year to the fourth quarter of the year") was 2.4%, the same as it was in projections released in December 2023 for 2024 (Federal Reserve - FOMC Projection Materials March 2024, Investopedia). The question will be suspended on 11 June 2024 and the outcome determined using the next projection materials released by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), expected on the second day of its two-day meeting scheduled for 11-12 June 2024 (Federal Reserve).This question is part of the 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge. Click here for more details.

Question: What will President Biden's approval rating be as of 7 June 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight?
Description: The question will be suspended on 6 June 2024 and the outcome determined using "All polls" chart data provided by FiveThirtyEight's "How [un]popular is Joe Biden?" page (FiveThirtyEight). As of the launch of this question, Biden's approval rating on 4 January 2024 was 38.3%. The data for 7 June 2024 will be accessed for resolution at approximately 5:00PM ET on 11 June 2024.

Question: What percentage of the vote will the Alliance for the Unity of Romanians (Alianța pentru Unirea Românilor, or AUR) party list win in the 2024 European Parliament (EP) elections?
Description: The right-wing AUR has gained popularity in Romania to the consternation of pro-EU observers (Euronews, Antena 3 CNN [in Romanian], Romania Insider, AUD). In the event of the renaming of a political group or its fragmentation into two or more parties, further instructions will be provided. If AUR merges with another party, that new party will count. The question will be suspended on 8 June 2024, with the elections scheduled for 9 June 2024 (EU Elections). There are a total of 33 Romanian seats up in the 2024 EP elections (European Parliament).

Question: What will be voter turnout in France for the 2024 European Parliamentary elections?
Description: As European Parliamentary elections approach, a recent poll indicates a high degree of ignorance and indifference among the electorate in France (France 24). The question will be suspended on 8 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data as reported by the EU (EU Elections). The election is scheduled to take place 8-9 June 2024, depending on where a person votes (Service-Public.fr [in French]).

Question: Will Swiss voters reject the "Federal Law on a Secure Power Supply with Renewable Energies" by referendum in 2024?
Description: In September 2023, the Swiss parliament passed the "Federal Law on a Secure Power Supply with Renewable Energies," which was designed to make transition to renewable energy sources easier, though aspects of the legislation raised the ire of conservationists in the country (Photon.info, Swiss Times, Fondation Franz Weber [in German], Swiss Times). The referendum is scheduled for 9 June 2024 (Swiss Info, Federal Constitution of the Swiss Confederation - Article 141). The question will close upon the vote on the referendum, irrespective of its outcome.

Question: Will Benny Gantz cease to be a member of the Israeli government before 11 June 2024?
Description: Benny Gantz joined the Israeli government in the wake of Hamas' attack on Israel on 7 October 2023, but he has threatened to quit the government if it doesn't adopt a new plan for Gaza "by June 8" (BBC, Axios, The National). Gantz need only leave the government, not the Knesset, to count.

Question: Will a player seeded third or higher win the Men's Single Final at the 2024 French Open?
Description: The 2024 French Open will be the 127th, and whether past winner Rafael Nadal will participate was still to be determined as of 3 May 2024 (BBC, Sporting News). The tennis Grand Slam tournament is scheduled from 20 May 2024 to 9 June 2024, with the Men's Single Final scheduled for 9 June 2024 (French Open (Roland-Garros) - Tentative Schedule). For the purposes of this question, "third or higher" means first, second, or third.

Question: Will a player seeded fourth or higher win the Women's Single Final at the 2024 French Open?
Description: Polish tennis star Iga Świątek will try to win the French Open for a fourth time in five years (Tennis.com). The 2024 French Open is scheduled from 20 May 2024 to 9 June 2024, with the Women's Single Final scheduled for 8 June 2024 (French Open (Roland-Garros) - Tentative Schedule). For the purposes of this question, "fourth or higher" means first, second, third, or fourth.

Question: Will a crewed Boeing Starliner spacecraft successfully dock with the International Space Station (ISS) before 1 September 2024?
Description: After years of delays, Boeing is pushing for its first launch with a crew aboard in 2024 (NASA Spaceflight, Boeing - Starliner Updates).

Question: When will the European Central Bank (ECB) announce a reduction to its "Deposit facility" interest rate?
Description: As eurozone inflation eases, markets are anticipating an interest rate cut from the ECB in 2024 (AP, US News & World Report, ECB - Key ECB Interest Rates). As of the launch of this question, the Governing Council of the ECB had six remaining monetary policy meetings scheduled for 2024: 11 April, 6 June, 18 July, 12 September, 17 October, and 12 December (ECB - Calendar). The date the change would take effect is immaterial.

Question: Before 15 June 2024, will the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Board of Governors adopt a new resolution or other instrument calling for better cooperation from Iran regarding its nuclear program?
Description: In March 2024, the US and other IAEA member states threatened future actions against Iran for "stonewalling" the IAEA's work to monitor the country's nuclear program (Arms Control Association, US News & World Report). The last such resolution was adopted in November 2022 (Al Jazeera, IAEA - Iran IAEA Resolutions). The next IAEA Board of Governors meeting is scheduled for 3-7 June 2024 (IAEA - Upcoming Events).

Question: Will the Japanese House of Representatives be dissolved before 5 June 2024?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: Prime Minister Kishida was reportedly considering seeking the dissolution of the House of Representatives to call early elections, but he has thus far declined to do so (Japan Times, Yahoo, AP, Japan PM Office - Japan Constitution).

Question: How many seats in the Lok Sabha will the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) win in the next Indian general election?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: The next general election for the Lok Sabha, the lower house of India's bicameral parliament, is scheduled for phases in the spring of 2024 (Economist, US News & World Report). Incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its NDA electoral alliance hoping to extend their majority for another term, though it faces challenges ahead (AP, Times of India). The suspend date will be changed to the day before polls are scheduled to close in the first phase of voting once officially set, expected between April and May 2024 (e.g., 2019 Al Jazeera). In the event of a split within the NDA, the electoral alliance including the BJP will be considered the successor to the NDA.

Question: Who will win the Democratic primary for the US Senate election for New Jersey in 2024?
Description: As incumbent Senator Bob Menendez faces federal corruption charges, New Jersey First Lady Tammy Murphy, Rep. Andy Kim, and others are vying for the Democratic nomination (AP, Politico, The Hill). The Democratic primary is scheduled for 4 June 2024 (Ballotpedia).

Question: What percentage of the vote will the MORENA party candidate win in the next Mexican general election?
Description: The next Mexican general election is scheduled for 2 June 2024, which includes a presidential election (Economist, AP, Mexico National Electoral Institute). In the event of the renaming of MORENA or its fragmentation into two or more parties, further instructions will be provided.
choices: 50.0% or less and will not win the election
50.0% or less but will win the election

Question: How many National Assembly seats will the African National Congress (ANC) win in the 2024 South African general election?
Description: All 400 seats in the South Africa National Assembly will be up for a vote in the next general election, which has had an ANC majority since the first post-apartheid election of 1994 (Economist, Voice of America Africa, South African Parliament - National Assembly, Britannica - ANC, Africa News). The general election is expected in or around May 2024, and the close date for this question will be changed once the official election date is set.

Question: Which football (soccer) club will win the 2023-24 UEFA Champions League final?
Description: The 2023-24 UEFA Champions League final is scheduled to be played at Wembley Stadium in London, England, on 1 June 2024 (UEFA, UEFA - Clubs).

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in May 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 30 May 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of May 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with a "5" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in May 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 164.15, 123.07, 123.84, 158.47, and 129.19. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: What will be the annualized rate of US housing starts for June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The rate of housing starts, a measure of new home construction in the US, has trended down since April 2022 as interest rates price many potential homebuyers out of the market (US News & World Report, National Association of Realtors). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data provided by the US Census Bureau as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database for June 2024, expected in July 2024 (FRED). As of the launch of this question, housing starts totaled 1,418 thousand, or 1.418 million, in June 2023.
choices: At least 1.15 million, but fewer than 1.30 million
At least 1.30 million, but fewer than 1.45 million
At least 1.45 million, but fewer than 1.60 million
At least 1.60 million, but fewer than 1.75 million
target: At least 1.30 million, but fewer than 1.45 million

Question: How many total Southwest Land Border Encounters will be reported in the US from January 2024 through June 2024 by US Customs and Border Protection (CBP)?
Description: The continued influx of people illegally crossing the US border with Mexico has become a major issue in the 2024 US presidential campaign (ABC7 Chicago, ABC News, Fox News). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data as reported by CBP for the calendar months of January 2024 through June 2024 once data for June 2024 are first reported (CBP). Between calendar January 2023 and June 2023, CBP reported a total of 1,070,475 encounters in the US southwest as of the launch of this question.

Question: How many seats will the European People's Party Group (EPP) win in the 2024 European Parliament (EP) elections?
Description: The EPP is currently the largest political group (i.e., party) in the EP (Politico, Politico - Poll of Polls). In the event of the renaming of a political group or its fragmentation into two or more parties, further instructions will be provided. The question will be suspended on 5 June 2024, with the elections scheduled for 6-9 June 2024 (Economist, European Parliament - Elections). In the event of a tie, the political group with more total votes in the elections will be considered to have won more seats. The outcome will be determined on the day of the first meeting of the Tenth European Parliament.

Question: How many seats will the Identity & Democracy Group (ID) win in the 2024 European Parliament (EP) elections?
Description: The ID is a right-wing, Euroskeptic political group (i.e., party) in the EP, which polls indicate is set to gain seats in the June 2024 elections (Guardian, US News & World Report, Identity and Democracy Group, European Parliament - Political Groups, Politico - Poll of Polls). In the event of the renaming of a political group or its fragmentation into two or more parties, further instructions will be provided. The question will be suspended on 5 June 2024, with the elections scheduled for 6-9 June 2024 (European Parliament). There are a total of 720 seats up in the 2024 EP elections (European Parliament). The outcome will be determined on the day of the first meeting of the Tenth European Parliament.

Question: Who will Donald Trump announce as his running mate in the 2024 US presidential election?
Description: Speculation abounds as to who Trump will pick as his running mate for the 2024 presidential election (US News & World Report, BBC, CNN). Formal nomination at the Republican National Convention is immaterial, and the announcement must be made publicly by Donald Trump to count.
choices: Trump will not announce a running mate for the 2024 presidential election before 19 July 2024 or will cease to be a candidate

Question: Will Donald Trump cease to be a candidate for the 2024 Republican nomination for US president before 15 July 2024?
Description: Trump is leading the shrinking field of Republican candidates for president as his legal issues continue (NBC News, ABC News, Politico). Examples of what will count for resolution of this question include an official announcement that Trump no longer seeks the Republican Party nomination for president or that he is fully suspending his campaign.

Question: What will be China's annual GDP growth rate for the second quarter of 2024?
Description: Forecasts for China's economic growth in 2024 have been modest as the country deals with various economic issues, particularly in its property sector (Economist, Yahoo, US News & World Report). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using quarterly data from the National Bureau of Statistics of China as first reported by Trading Economics, expected in July 2024 (Trading Economics).
choices: Higher by less than 1.0% or lower
Higher by at least 1.0%, but less than 2.5%
Higher by at least 2.5%, but less than 4.0%
Higher by at least 4.0%, but less than 5.5%
Higher by at least 5.5%, but less than 7.0%
target: Higher by at least 4.0%, but less than 5.5%

Question: Which national team will win the UEFA EURO 2024 Final?
Description: The Euro 2024 tournament, hosted in cities across Germany, begins 14 June 2024 with the Final scheduled for 14 July 2024 (CBS Sports, UEFA EURO 2024).

Question: Will the full US House of Representatives vote on impeaching President Joe Biden before 13 July 2024?
Description: On 13 December 2023, the House of Representatives voted to authorize an impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden, which had begun in September 2023 at the behest of then-Speaker Kevin McCarthy (AP, Axios). Only votes by the full House of Representatives will count (Congressional Research Service). The question will not close early upon a full House vote to not impeach President Biden.
choices: Yes, and the full House will vote in the affirmative to impeach President Biden
Yes, but the full House will not vote in the affirmative to impeach President Biden

Question: Will Donald Trump be criminally charged under 18 U.S.C. §2383 (Rebellion or insurrection) before 13 July 2024?
Description: While Donald Trump was facing various federal criminal charges as of December 2023, he had not been charged under 18 U.S.C. §2383, which provides criminal consequences for involvement in "rebellion or insurrection against the authority of the United States or the laws thereof" (Cornell - 18 U.S.C. §2383, Lawfare, Politico). The Colorado Supreme Court ruled that Trump was disqualified from being president under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment due to him having "engaged in insurrection or rebellion," a decision expected to be reviewed by the US Supreme Court (Congress.gov - 14th Amendment, CBS News, Axios).

Question: When will the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) file a civil complaint against OpenAI?
Description: In July 2023, the FTC sent OpenAI, the firm that created ChatGPT, a civil investigative demand letter for information as part of an investigation into whether OpenAI has violated consumer protection laws (CNBC, NPR, Washington Post - Demand Letter). A complaint under seal would only count upon being unsealed, and a complaint filed in court or as an administrative action would count.

Description: US inflation in January 2024 rose more than analysts expected, potentially lengthening the path to the Federal Reserve's target of 2% (CNBC, Investopedia - CPI). Up by more than 3.000% but less than 3.600%

Description: The rate of inflation in the US is well off historic highs in 2022, but when it will fall to the Federal Reserve's 2% target remains in focus (CNBC, USA Today, NBC News, Investopedia - CPI). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using the 12-month percentage change for June 2024 as first released by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) for "All items," expected in July 2024 (BLS). Question: What will be the spot price per million BTUs for natural gas on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: Record domestic natural gas production in the US has pushed prices to multidecade lows (MSN,  EIA - Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using the spot price per million British thermal units (BTUs) per the US Energy Information Administration (EIA) as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected in July 2024 (FRED, EIA - British thermal units). On 28 June 2023, the spot price for natural gas was $2.71.

Question: Between 9 October 2023 and 9 July 2024, will the UK or a European Union member state publicly accuse a group or entity the EU lists as a terrorist group or entity of perpetrating an attack within either the UK or EU resulting in at least one fatality?
Description: For the purposes of this question, the groups or entities that the EU lists as a terrorist group or entity are those listed in Council Decision (CFSP) 2023/1514 (EUR-Lex). An attack in the territorial waters or airspace of either the UK or a European Union member state would count. Both the attack and the accusation must occur during the question's open period to count.

Question: Before 6 July 2024, will American journalist Evan Gershkovich leave Russia?
Description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich was arrested in Russia on 29 March 2023 for espionage, a claim he denies (Politico). US officials have said that there have been discussions with Russia on a possible prisoner exchange (Fox News, AP). Gershkovich must leave Russia alive to count.

Question: Will early elections for the French National Assembly (Assemblée Nationale) be called before 1 July 2025?
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron is facing an emboldened opposition as National Rally (Rassemblement National, or RN) climbs in the polls (Le Monde, Yahoo [Telegraph]). If early elections are scheduled for a date after 30 June 2025, the suspend date will be extended to the day before the second-round date in the elections scheduled. If RN secures a plurality (or majority) or it is mathematically impossible after the first round, the question will close as of the date of the first round of elections. The constitutional mechanism used to dissolve the National Assembly and call early elections is found in Article 12 of the Constitution of the Fifth Republic (French Constitution, Le Monde).
choices: Yes, and RN will win the most seats
Yes, but RN will not win the most seats
target: Yes, but RN will not win the most seats

Question: How many seats will the Rassemblement National (National Rally, or RN) party/alliance win in the next French National Assembly elections?
Description: After the RN made major gains in European Parliament elections on 9 June 2024, French President Emmanuel Macron dissolved the National Assembly and called new elections, with two rounds scheduled for 30 June and 7 July 2024 (Politico, MSN [Reuters]). If RN forms an electoral alliance as of the date of the first round of the election, seats won by that alliance would count being won by RN.

Question: Who will win the next Iranian presidential election?
Description: With the death of Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, an election for his replacement has been scheduled for 28 June 2024 (Al Arabiya, AP, Constitution of Iran, see Article 131). If no candidate wins an absolute majority, a runoff between the two candidates receiving the most votes would take place the following Friday (Constitution of Iran, see Article 117). The question will close early upon the election date (including a second round, as necessary) being rescheduled to a date after 2 August 2024.
choices: Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf, aka Mohammad Baqer Qalibaf (current speaker of Iranian parliament)
Mojtaba Khamenei (son of Supreme Leader Khamenei)
Ali Larijani (former speaker of Iranian parliament)
The election (including a second round, as necessary) will not be held before 3 August 2024

Question: Between 1 March 2024 and 30 June 2024, how many total fatalities will occur in Sudan due to conflicts and protests, according to ACLED?
Description: In April 2023, fighting erupted between the When will the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) for control of the country, and fighting has continued ever since (CNN, Vox, CBS News). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data as reported by the Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED) Dashboard (ACLED). On the left side of the screen, (1) set the "EVENT DATE" range as appropriate, (2) for "EVENT TYPE, select all, (3) for "REGION," select only "Sudan" under "Northern Africa," (4) for "FATALITIES," leave all boxes unchecked, (5) for "ACTOR TYPE," select all, (6) for "INTERACTION," select all, and click "APPLY FILTERS." Totals for "EVENTS" and "FATALITIES" will appear above the map. As of the launch of this question, ACLED reported 13,040 total fatalities in Sudan between 1 April 2023 and 31 December 2023.

Question: What will be the US civilian unemployment rate (U3) for June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The US unemployment rate has remained near historic lows in early 2024 despite multidecade highs in interest rates (CNBC, Department of Labor - Initial Unemployment Claims 29 February 2024). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using the Bureau of Labor Statistics' official civilian unemployment rate (U3) as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database when first released, expected in July 2024 (FRED).

Question: How many seats will the Conservative Party win in the next UK general election?
Description: The next UK general election is scheduled to be held on 4 July 2024 (BBC, Guardian).
choices: At least 138 seats, but fewer than 185 seats
At least 185 seats, but fewer than 232 seats

At least 279 seats, but fewer than 326 seats

Question: What will be the spot price per barrel for West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: Oil prices were approaching $80 per barrel amid continued violence in the Middle East and potential OPEC+ actions (Yahoo). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using the spot price per barrel per the US Energy Information Administration (EIA) as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected in July 2024 (FRED). On 28 June 2023, the spot price for WTI was $69.54.

Question: When will Rishi Sunak cease to be prime minister of the United Kingdom?
Description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is facing weak polling and has reportedly said that there will be parliamentary elections called in 2024 (MSN, The Independent, BBC).

Question: What will be the national average price of a gallon of gasoline on 3 July 2024, according to the American Automobile Association (AAA)?
Description: Gas prices in the US fell in the final quarter of 2023, but they have begun to climb again for various reasons (CNN, Nerd Wallet, CNBC). The question will be suspended on 2 July 2024 and the outcome determined using data as reported by AAA for 3 July 2024 (AAA, see "Today's AAA National Average" graphic).

Question: Who will be sworn in as the next prime minister of the Netherlands?
Description: The nationalist Freedom Party (PVV) led by Geert Wilders won the most seats in the Dutch general elections held on 22 November 2023, setting the stage for a potentially difficult path to forming a government (aka cabinet) (AP, BBC, Dutch House of Representatives - Cabinet). The appointment of a new caretaker prime minister would not count.
choices: Geert Wilders of the Freedom Party (PVV)
Another member of the Freedom Party (PVV)
A member of either the Green Left Party (GL) or Labour Party (PvdA)
A member of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD)
No new prime minister will be sworn in before 23 November 2024 or new elections will be called

Question: When will a new Dutch government be sworn in?
Description: The nationalist Freedom Party (PVV) won the most seats in the Dutch general elections held on 22 November 2023, setting the stage for a potentially difficult path to forming a government (aka cabinet) (Politico, AP, Dutch House of Representatives - Cabinet). After the 2017 election, it took parties a then-record 255 days from the election to form a government, with government formation after the 2021 election taking 299 days (Dutch News, Anadolu Agency). A caretaker government will not count, and whether new elections are called is immaterial.

Question: Will Donald Trump be sentenced to serve time in prison for his New York state conviction on falsifying business records?
Description: On 30 May 2024, Trump was convicted on 34 felony charges related to falsifying business records, after which the judge scheduled a sentencing hearing for 11 July 2024 (ABC News, Axios). A prison sentence fully suspended by the trial court judge will not count as being sentenced to serve time in prison (Cornell - Suspended Sentence). The question will close early if the judge in the case postpones the sentencing hearing to a date after 9 August 2024.
choices: Yes, and he will not be granted bail pending appeal
Yes, but he will be granted bail pending appeal
Trump will not be sentenced for the conviction before 10 August 2024
target: Trump will not be sentenced for the conviction before 10 August 2024

Question: How many total vessels will transit through the Suez Canal in the first calendar quarter of 2024?
Description: Various shipping firms have begun diverting traffic away from the Red Sea and bypassing the Suez Canal as Iranian-backed Houthi forces launch attacks against commercial vessels off the coast of Yemen (CNBC, MSN, Newsweek). In October 2023, the Suez Canal Authority announced increases in transit dues (i.e., tolls) for using the Suez Canal that are to take effect 15 January 2024 (Suez Canal Authority). The question will be suspended on 31 March 2024 and the outcome determined using fiscal year (FY) Q3 2023/2024 data (FY Q3 2023/2024 is the same as the first calendar quarter of 2024) as reported by the Central Bank of Egypt in its monthly statistical bulletin once FY Q3 2023/2024 are first reported, expected in April 2024 (Central Bank of Egypt). In its September 2023 Monthly Statistical Bulletin, the Central Bank of Egypt reported a total of 6,523 transits through the Suez Canal (Central Bank of Egypt - Monthly Statistical Bulletin September 2023, see "31/1 -Traffic in the Suez Canal" at the bottom of page 54 of 93 of the PDF; see "Number" under "Total" for "Q1" under 2023/2024, inforMARE). You may download consolidated historical data here: https://goodjudgment.io/docs/Suez_Canal_Total_Transits_Calendar_Q4_2018_-_Q3_2023_19_December_2023.xlsx.

Question: What will be the spot exchange rate value of the Chinese yuan renminbi to one US dollar on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The Federal Reserve releases daily bilateral exchange rate data on a weekly basis (Federal Reserve). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Federal Reserve data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected in early July 2024 (FRED). On 12 February 2024, the spot exchange rate value was 7.1928.

Question: How many total vehicles will Tesla deliver to customers in the second quarter of 2024?
Challenges_list: 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge
Description: Tesla missed delivery expectations in the first quarter of 2024 (CNBC, Electrek). The question will be suspended on 30 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Tesla's Production & Delivery press release for Q2 2024, typically found under "Production & Delivery" (Tesla - Quarterly Results). Tesla's total vehicle deliveries in the first quarter of 2024 was 386,810 (Tesla - Production & Deliveries Q1 2024).This question is part of the 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge. Click here for more details.

Question: Will India lift its ban on the export of white rice from the country before 2 July 2024?
Description: India banned exports of non-basmati white rice in July 2023 as part of an effort to rein in food prices in the country, and they are expected by observers to stay in place through India's spring election cycle (CNBC, Ministry of Consumer Affairs, MSN, The Wire (India), Economic Times). A general lifting of the ban would count, irrespective of whether it is replaced by quotas or tariffs. Special exceptions to the ban (e.g., allowing the export of limited amounts of white rice for a specific destination) alone would not count, and the lifting of the ban must occur during the question's open period to count.

Question: What will be the yield for US 10-year Treasury securities on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The yield (or interest rate) of the 10-year Treasury is a major benchmark for finance in the US (Investopedia). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using US Treasury data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database, expected the following week (FRED). On 12 February 2024, the yield was 4.17%.

Question: Between 29 September 2023 and 30 June 2024, will the UN Security Council increase the number of troops authorized in Somalia after 30 June 2024 under the mandate for the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS)?
Description: ATMIS, an African Union mission in Somalia there to support the fight against Al-Shabaab and other groups, was intended to withdraw in 4 phases (UN Security Council Resolution 2687 (2023), ATMIS, Amani Africa). As of the launch of this question, the Phase 3 withdrawal is due to be completed by the end of June 2024 (UN Security Council Resolution 2628 (2022), see §28). This follows phase 2 whose deadline was extended to the end of 2023 (Africa News). An increase in permitted personnel after June 2024 or an extension in time at higher numbers would count.

Question: In NetChoice, LLC v. Paxton, will the Supreme Court rule that the viewpoint-based censorship restrictions (Section 7) in Texas' social media censorship law (HB 20) complies with the First Amendment?
Description: The Supreme Court agreed to hear challenges to House Bill 20 (HB 20), a Texas law that, among other things, prohibits qualifying social media companies from censoring users based on the viewpoint of their expression (Economist, Texas.gov, Oyez, LegiScan - HB 20, see Section 7). The district court issued a preliminary injunction barring enforcement of the law, which the Fifth Circuit reversed and NetChoice appealed to the Supreme Court (SCOTUSblog, Politico, The Verge). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." If the Court rules that Section 7 facially complies with the First Amendment and/or "as applied" to all parties of the case, the question will close "Yes," regardless of the potential of other future challenges (Bona Law). The outcome of Moody v. NetChoice, LLC, a companion case out of Florida, is immaterial.

Question: Before 1 July 2024, will NATO or a NATO member state publicly accuse Russia of attacking a crewed, non-Ukrainian-flagged vessel in the Black Sea outside of Ukrainian and Russian territorial waters?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: As Russia's war in Ukraine grinds on, Ukraine has tried to restart trade via the Black Sea after the expiration of the Black Sea Grain Initiative in July 2023 (Yahoo, UN - Black Sea Grain Initiative, Farm Policy News). For the purposes of this question, "attacking" means striking a pertinent vessel with a weapon (e.g., bullets, missiles, but not fire hoses, throwing garbage, etc.) or deliberately ramming that vessel with another vessel.

Question: When will NATO and/or a NATO member state publicly accuse Republic of Serbia national military forces and/or law enforcement of either entering Kosovo without authorization or firing a weapon or weapons into Kosovo?
Description: Tensions in Kosovo have escalated in 2023, with ethnic Serb protesters clashing with NATO's KFOR peacekeeping forces in late May, a firefight between Kosovo law enforcement and ethnic Serb gunmen at an Orthodox monastery, and reports of forces of the Republic of Serbia amassing at the border (AP, France 24, BBC). The Republic of Serbia requested to deploy forces in Kosovo in December 2022, but KFOR declined (Politico). For the purposes of this question, "firing weapons into Kosovo" means the shooting of bullets, artillery shells, rockets, offensive drones, or other munitions into the territory or airspace of Kosovo. The entering of forces or firing of weapons and the accusation of such must take place in the question's open period to count.

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in June 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 29 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of June 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with a "6" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in June 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 136.30, 114.17, 119.32, 123.76, and 103.15. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: Before 1 July 2024, will the US, IAEA, and/or a UN agency publicly state that it believes it more likely than not that Iran possesses a nuclear weapon capable of being detonated?
Description: Various group continue to voice concern that Iran is developing a nuclear weapons capability (AP, US News & World Report). A public statement from a US military or federal agency would count. The testing or detonation of a nuclear device would not be necessary for resolution. A radiological device (aka "dirty bomb") would not count (Mass.gov). "Roughly even chance" or "roughly even odds" without an explicit statement that the probability is greater than 50% would not count. For further information on US intelligence community terminology on probabilities and confidence, see Intelligence Community Directive 203 (Federation of American Scientists).

Question: In Trump v. US, will the Supreme Court rule that Donald Trump is immune from prosecution in his appeal from the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia (DC Circuit)?
Description: On 28 February 2024, the Supreme Court agreed to hear Trump's appeal (Supremecourt.gov - Trump v. US Docket) from the DC Circuit's decision that he did not have presidential immunity from criminal prosecution for events related to the 6 January 2021 riot at the Capitol Building (SCOTUSblog, CBS News, The Hill, DC Circuit - US v. Trump). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law as to Trump and the criminal charges in place that gave rise to this case, the question will close as "No." A ruling that Trump has immunity for some, but not all, criminal charges at issue will not count.

Question: Before 1 July 2024, will the Scottish Parliament vote in the affirmative for early elections?
Description: The push in Scotland for independence from the United Kingdom continues, with early Scottish Parliament elections suggested as a means toward that end by the independence-minded Scottish National Party (Yahoo UK, The National). Under the Scotland Act of 1998, the Scottish Parliament may dissolve itself and seek early elections if supported by a two-thirds majority, though some members of the Scottish Parliament (MSPs) have discussed attempting to do so with a simple majority bill (Legislation.gov.uk - Scotland Act, Section 3, The Scotsman, The National). In the story from "The National" in the preceding sentence, the "one-line bill to get around the Fixed-term Parliaments Act" refers to the Early Parliamentary General Election Act of 2019 (Legislation.gov.uk - Early Parliamentary General Election Act 2019, House of Commons Library). The question would close upon the announcement of results of a qualifying vote that would lead to early elections, irrespective of any judicial intervention, acts of the Parliament of the United Kingdom, and or Royal Assent. The Scottish Parliament will be deemed to have voted in the affirmative for early elections upon reaching the minimum threshold for passage under the purported legal authority invoked by the parliament (e.g., two-thirds under the terms of the Scotland Act, simple majority by means of legislation only requiring a simple majority).

Question: Will the World Health Organization (WHO) declare a new Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) before 1 July 2024?
Description: A PHEIC is defined by WHO as "an extraordinary event which is determined to constitute a public health risk to other States through the international spread of disease and to potentially require a coordinated international response" under International Health Regulations, with recent examples including COVID-19, Monkeypox, and wild polio (International Health Regulations 2005, linked here under publications - WHO - International Health Regulations, International Health Regulations - Annex II, Pan American Health Organization, NPR).

Question: Which cricket team will win the 2024 Men's T20 World Cup Final?
Description: The International Cricket Council's (ICC's) Men's T20 World Cup is scheduled to begin on 4 June 2024 in the US and West Indies, with the final scheduled for 30 June 2024 (Economist, T20 World Cup, Britannica - Twenty20 Cricket).

Question: In NY Times v. Microsoft/OpenAI, will a federal court issue any injunctive relief for the NY Times against any named defendant related to the use of its copyrighted materials to train large language models (LLMs) before 29 June 2024?
Description: On 27 December 2023, the New York Times Company (NY Times) filed a civil complaint in the US District Court for the Southern District of New York seeking, among other things, action by the court to prevent Microsoft and OpenAI from using its intellectual property to train LLMs like ChatGPT without compensation (AP, CNBC, NY Times v. Microsoft, et al.). Whether the relief takes the form of an injunction or restraining order is immaterial (Cornell - Injunctive Relief, Cornell - FRCP Rule 65). Injunctive relief as to the use of an LLM trained with NY Times' copyrighted material would count. Whether injunctive relief is stayed pending appeal is immaterial.

Question: Will former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro be arrested by public authorities before 29 June 2024?
Description: On 19 March 2024, a Brazilian federal police indictment against Bolsonaro was released by the country's Supreme Court, which included accusations of fraud related to whether he was vaccinated for COVID-19, though the decision whether to criminally charge him falls to the prosecutor-general's office (AP, Guardian, Yahoo). The ordering of Bolsonaro to house arrest with Bolsonaro's presence at the pertinent home confirmed will count. Brazilian airspace and territorial waters are considered to be "inside" Brazil. The jurisdiction served by public authorities who arrest Bolsonaro is immaterial.

Question: What will be the closing value of the S&P 500 Index on 28 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: The S&P 500 Index is one of the most followed indices for equity markets in the world (Investopedia - S&P 500). The question will be suspended on 27 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data from S&P as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED).

Question: In Fischer v. United States, will the Supreme Court rule that 18 U.S.C. § 1512(c), which prohibits obstruction of congressional inquiries and investigations, can be used to prosecute Joseph Fischer for his actions in the riot at the US Capitol on 6 January 2021?
Description: Joseph Fischer and others were charged with crimes for their actions in the riot at the US Capitol Building on 6 January 2021 as Congress was tallying electoral votes, including a criminal charge for violating 18 U.S.C. § 1512(c) that concerns obstruction of congressional inquiries and investigations (SCOTUSblog). The District Court dismissed the charges made under 1512(c) against various defendants, deciding that the statute does not apply to the circumstances in the case (Casetext - US v. Miller (DC Circuit Court of Appeals), Lawfare). The DC Court of Appeals reversed the District Court, and the Supreme Court agreed to hear the case (Lawfare, CBS News). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." Any Supreme Court disposition of a case involving Edward Lang or Garret Miller will be immaterial.

Question: In Loper Bright Enterprises v. Raimondo, will the Supreme Court explicitly overrule Chevron U.S.A. v. Natural Resources Defense Council (Chevron), which requires courts to defer to federal agency interpretations of statutes?
Description: "Chevron deference" is among the most important principles in administrative law in the US, though it has faced a great deal of criticism (Cornell - Chevron Deference, Politico). Fishing companies, including Loper Bright Enterprises, sued the federal government over an administrative rule requiring them to help fund a monitoring program, and appealed to the Supreme Court after losing in both district and circuit courts (Oyez). The fishing companies have asked if Chevron should be overruled or clarified as to statutory silence on certain matters (SCOTUSblog, Holland & Knight). A mere clarification under the existing Chevron framework would not count. The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: In City of Grants Pass v. Johnson, will the Supreme Court rule that the City's enforcement of its ban on public camping against homeless people violated the Eighth Amendment's bar against cruel and unusual punishment?
Description: Grants Pass, Oregon, adopted various ordinances intended to prohibit people from sleeping or camping outside within city limits, which were challenged in a class action lawsuit filed on behalf of homeless people in the area (Oyez, SCOTUSblog). The district court ruled against the City and Ninth Circuit affirmed (Casetext - Johnson v. City of Grants Pass, Washington State Standard). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." If the Court rules that enforcement of the ban could violate the Eighth Amendment but did not as applied to the Respondents (i.e., the named class representatives), the question would close as "No."

Question: Will "Bronny" James be drafted in the 2024 NBA Draft?
Description: Bronny James, the son of NBA star LeBron James, announced in April 2024 that he would enter both the NBA draft and the NCAA transfer portal, and he was medically cleared for the draft in early May 2024 (ESPN, NBC News, 247 Sports). The 2024 NBA Draft is scheduled for 26-27 June 2024 (NBA). The question will close early if James withdraws from the draft and would be ineligible to re-enter.

Question: What will be the weekly average interest rate for 30-year fixed rate mortgages in the US for the week ending 27 June 2024?
Challenges_list: "Right!" said FRED: Q2 2024 Finance and Economics Challenge
Description: Mortgage rates rose in early 2024 as markets tempered expectations of near-term Federal Reserve interest rate cuts (ABC News). The question will be suspended 26 June 2024 and the outcome determined using Freddie Mac 30-year fixed rate mortgage average data as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database (FRED). For the week ending 29 June 2023, the weekly average interest rate for 30-year fixed-rate mortgages in the US was 6.71%.

Question: In Harrington v. Purdue Pharma L.P., will the Supreme Court rule that a bankruptcy court could approve OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma's reorganization plan, which includes nonconsensual, nondebtor releases?
Description: Purdue Pharma declared bankruptcy as it faced heavy liability for its role in the US opioid crisis, and agreed in a bankruptcy court to contribute billions of dollars in exchange for, among other things, a release from further civil liability for the Sackler family owners of the firm (AP, CNN, USA Today). A federal district court ruled that the bankruptcy court lacked the authority to approve a plan that included nonconsensual releases for third parties, which the Second Circuit reversed due to binding precedent (Oyez, SCOTUSblog, Second Circuit - In Re: Purdue Pharma (2023)). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: In Murthy v. Missouri, will the Supreme Court rule that any of the federal government's actions regarding social media content moderation violated the First Amendment?
Description: The Attorneys General of Louisiana and Missouri sued the federal government in 2022 claiming that different federal agencies were exerting unconstitutional influence over content moderation actions by various social media companies (KOMU, Oyez). After a Louisiana district court imposed a broad injunction against several agencies preventing them from contacting social media companies, the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals limited the reach of that injunction, and the Biden administration appealed to the Supreme Court (The Verge, AP, SCOTUSblog). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No." A ruling that any particular action violated the First Amendment would count.

Question: In what place will Rep. Lauren Boebert come in the 2024 Republican primary for Colorado's 4th Congressional District?
Description: Facing stiff challenges in the congressional district she currently represents, Rep. Lauren Boebert announced for the 2024 US elections that she would run in Colorado's 4th Congressional District, where incumbent Rep. Ken Buck has decided not to seek reelection (CBS News, Post Independent, The Hill). The Republican primary is scheduled for 25 June 2024 (Ballotpedia). If Boebert does not appear on the ballot for whatever reason, the question will close "Fourth or lower." In the event of a tie for first place, the outcome will be determined based on the tie-breaking procedures used under Colorado state law (eBenchBook - CRS 1-11-101, see (3)).

Question: Which NHL hockey team will win the 2024 Stanley Cup Final?
Description: The 2023 Stanley Cup Final is scheduled for June 2024 (NHL Playoff, NHL - Standings).

Question: What will be the annualized rate of US housing starts for May 2024?
Description: The rate of housing starts, a measure of new home construction in the US, has trended down since May 2023 as interest rates price many potential homebuyers out of the market (US News & World Report, CNBC, Yahoo). The question will be suspended on 31 May 2024 and the outcome determined using data provided by the US Census Bureau as reported by the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database for May 2024, typically in June (FRED). As of the launch of this question, FRED reported that housing starts totaled 1.583 million in May 2023.
choices: More than 1.15 million but fewer than 1.30 million
More than 1.45 million but fewer than 1.60 million
target: More than 1.15 million but fewer than 1.30 million

Question: In Moore v. United States, will the Supreme Court rule that the Mandatory Repatriation Tax (MRT) is unconstitutional as to the Moores?
Description: Created by the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017, the MRT requires that taxes be paid on certain corporate earnings and profits from controlled foreign corporations (i.e., foreign corporations that are majority owned by US persons) (Casetext - Moore v US 9th Circuit, Tax Foundation). The Moores, investors in an Indian company, challenged the MRT as unconstitutional because it was, among other things, beyond the scope of income taxes permitted by the 16th Amendment to the US Constitution (Oyez). The outcome of the case may touch on the constitutional viability of a federal "wealth tax" in the US (ABC News, Bloomberg Tax). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: Will Serbia notify the Secretary General of the Council of Europe of its intention to withdraw from the organization before 18 June 2024?
Description: On 27 March 2024, a committee of the Council of Europe, a human rights organization, voted to recommend that Kosovo be granted membership (Balkan Insight, Council of Europe). Serbian President Aleksandar Vučić threatened to pull Serbia out of the Council of Europe if Kosovo is granted membership (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, Eunews). Per Article 7 of the Statute of the Council of Europe, a member "may withdraw by formally notifying the Secretary General of its intention to do so" (Statute of the Council of Europe).

Question: Which team will win the 2024 NBA Finals?
Description: The 2023-24 NBA Finals is scheduled to conclude no later than 20 June 2024 (NBA - Key Dates, NBA - Standings).

Question: What will be the US domestic box office gross in the opening weekend for Inside Out 2, according to Box Office Mojo?
Challenges_list: 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge
Description: After several disappointing box office performances, Disney is hoping to rebound in 2024 (ComicBook.com, Looper). The question will be suspended on 14 June 2024 and the outcome determined using non-estimate data as reported by Box Office Mojo for the weekend of 14-16 June 2024 (Box Office Mojo, see "Domestic Weekend"). The film is scheduled to be released on 14 June 2024 (Hollywood Reporter).This question is part of the 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge. Click here for more details.
choices: At least $50 million, but less than $75 million
At least $75 million, but less than $100 million
At least $100 million, but less than $125 million
At least $125 million, but less than $150 million

Question: When will Marianne Williamson cease to be a candidate for the 2024 Democratic nomination for US president?
Description: After dropping out of the presidential race on 7 February 2024 and re-entering on 28 February 2024, Marianne Williamson is perhaps the biggest name challenging President Biden for the Democratic nomination since Dean Phillips dropped out on 6 March 2024 (Ballotpedia, Fox News, Axios). Examples of what will count for resolution of this question include an official announcement that Williamson no longer seeks the Democratic Party nomination for president or that she is fully suspending her campaign.

Question: What will be the annual inflation rate in Argentina in May 2024?
Description: As Argentine President Javier Milei begins to implement major reforms in the economically troubled country, already high inflation is expected to spike (Economist, AP, MSN, Yahoo). The question will be suspended on 31 May 2024 and the outcome determined using National Institute of Statistics and Censuses (Spanish: "Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos," or "INDEC") data as reported by Trading Economics (Trading Economics). Historical data may be downloaded from the INDEC website (INDEC [in Spanish], see download options under "Índice de precios al consumidor con cobertura nacional").

Question: Will Tesla shareholders vote on changing the company's state of incorporation from Delaware to Texas or elsewhere before 31 August 2024?
Description: On 30 January 2024, a decision out of Delaware's Court of Chancery voided Elon Musk's Tesla pay package, which prompted Musk to call for a shareholder vote to move Tesla's state of incorporation to Texas (Delaware Court of Chancery - Tornetta v. Musk, CNBC, Investopedia). The question will close early if there is a vote in the affirmative for the move, but not if there is a vote that is not in the affirmative for the move.
choices: Yes, and the vote will be in the affirmative for the move
Yes, but the vote will not be in the affirmative for the move
target: Yes, and the vote will be in the affirmative for the move

Question: Before 13 June 2024, will the Federal Reserve announce a cut in the US federal funds rate?
Challenges_list: Thinking Analytically in an Uncertain World — Harvard Kennedy School Challenge (2023)
City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: As the Federal Reserve has increased interest rates to combat inflation, there are concerns whether the US will be pushed into recession (Yahoo Finance, CNBC). Conditional announcements (e.g., if the labor market deteriorates, if inflation falls) would not count, and the date a cut would take effect is immaterial. The last time the Federal Reserve announced a cut to the US federal funds rate was 15 March 2020 (Federal Reserve).

Question: At close of business on 12 June 2024, will the upper limit of the Federal Reserve's target range for the federal funds rate be lower, the same, or higher than it was at close of business on 1 May 2024?
Description: The US federal funds rate is the interest rate charged for overnight lending among financial institutions with accounts at the Federal Reserve and sets the base rate for borrowing costs across the financial system (Federal Reserve). The target range for the federal funds rate is set by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). Its June meeting is scheduled for 11-12 June 2024.

Question: What will be the Federal Reserve's median projection for personal consumption expenditures (PCE) inflation for 2024 in its June 2024 projection materials?
Challenges_list: 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge
Description: In the Federal Reserve's projection materials released on 20 March 2024, the median projection for PCE inflation for 2024 (specifically, "percent changes from the fourth quarter of the previous year to the fourth quarter of the year") was 2.4%, the same as it was in projections released in December 2023 for 2024 (Federal Reserve - FOMC Projection Materials March 2024, Investopedia). The question will be suspended on 11 June 2024 and the outcome determined using the next projection materials released by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), expected on the second day of its two-day meeting scheduled for 11-12 June 2024 (Federal Reserve).This question is part of the 2024 UBS Asset Management Investments Recruitment Challenge. Click here for more details.

Question: What will President Biden's approval rating be as of 7 June 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight?
Description: The question will be suspended on 6 June 2024 and the outcome determined using "All polls" chart data provided by FiveThirtyEight's "How [un]popular is Joe Biden?" page (FiveThirtyEight). As of the launch of this question, Biden's approval rating on 4 January 2024 was 38.3%. The data for 7 June 2024 will be accessed for resolution at approximately 5:00PM ET on 11 June 2024.

Question: What percentage of the vote will the Alliance for the Unity of Romanians (Alianța pentru Unirea Românilor, or AUR) party list win in the 2024 European Parliament (EP) elections?
Description: The right-wing AUR has gained popularity in Romania to the consternation of pro-EU observers (Euronews, Antena 3 CNN [in Romanian], Romania Insider, AUD). In the event of the renaming of a political group or its fragmentation into two or more parties, further instructions will be provided. If AUR merges with another party, that new party will count. The question will be suspended on 8 June 2024, with the elections scheduled for 9 June 2024 (EU Elections). There are a total of 33 Romanian seats up in the 2024 EP elections (European Parliament).

Question: What will be voter turnout in France for the 2024 European Parliamentary elections?
Description: As European Parliamentary elections approach, a recent poll indicates a high degree of ignorance and indifference among the electorate in France (France 24). The question will be suspended on 8 June 2024 and the outcome determined using data as reported by the EU (EU Elections). The election is scheduled to take place 8-9 June 2024, depending on where a person votes (Service-Public.fr [in French]).

Question: Will Swiss voters reject the "Federal Law on a Secure Power Supply with Renewable Energies" by referendum in 2024?
Description: In September 2023, the Swiss parliament passed the "Federal Law on a Secure Power Supply with Renewable Energies," which was designed to make transition to renewable energy sources easier, though aspects of the legislation raised the ire of conservationists in the country (Photon.info, Swiss Times, Fondation Franz Weber [in German], Swiss Times). The referendum is scheduled for 9 June 2024 (Swiss Info, Federal Constitution of the Swiss Confederation - Article 141). The question will close upon the vote on the referendum, irrespective of its outcome.

Question: When will the European Central Bank (ECB) announce a reduction to its "Deposit facility" interest rate?
Description: As eurozone inflation eases, markets are anticipating an interest rate cut from the ECB in 2024 (AP, US News & World Report, ECB - Key ECB Interest Rates). As of the launch of this question, the Governing Council of the ECB had six remaining monetary policy meetings scheduled for 2024: 11 April, 6 June, 18 July, 12 September, 17 October, and 12 December (ECB - Calendar). The date the change would take effect is immaterial.

Question: Before 15 June 2024, will the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Board of Governors adopt a new resolution or other instrument calling for better cooperation from Iran regarding its nuclear program?
Description: In March 2024, the US and other IAEA member states threatened future actions against Iran for "stonewalling" the IAEA's work to monitor the country's nuclear program (Arms Control Association, US News & World Report). The last such resolution was adopted in November 2022 (Al Jazeera, IAEA - Iran IAEA Resolutions). The next IAEA Board of Governors meeting is scheduled for 3-7 June 2024 (IAEA - Upcoming Events).

Question: Will the Japanese House of Representatives be dissolved before 5 June 2024?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: Prime Minister Kishida was reportedly considering seeking the dissolution of the House of Representatives to call early elections, but he has thus far declined to do so (Japan Times, Yahoo, AP, Japan PM Office - Japan Constitution).

Question: How many seats in the Lok Sabha will the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) win in the next Indian general election?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: The next general election for the Lok Sabha, the lower house of India's bicameral parliament, is scheduled for phases in the spring of 2024 (Economist, US News & World Report). Incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its NDA electoral alliance hoping to extend their majority for another term, though it faces challenges ahead (AP, Times of India). The suspend date will be changed to the day before polls are scheduled to close in the first phase of voting once officially set, expected between April and May 2024 (e.g., 2019 Al Jazeera). In the event of a split within the NDA, the electoral alliance including the BJP will be considered the successor to the NDA.

Question: Who will win the Democratic primary for the US Senate election for New Jersey in 2024?
Description: As incumbent Senator Bob Menendez faces federal corruption charges, New Jersey First Lady Tammy Murphy, Rep. Andy Kim, and others are vying for the Democratic nomination (AP, Politico, The Hill). The Democratic primary is scheduled for 4 June 2024 (Ballotpedia).

Question: What percentage of the vote will the MORENA party candidate win in the next Mexican general election?
Description: The next Mexican general election is scheduled for 2 June 2024, which includes a presidential election (Economist, AP, Mexico National Electoral Institute). In the event of the renaming of MORENA or its fragmentation into two or more parties, further instructions will be provided.
choices: 50.0% or less and will not win the election
50.0% or less but will win the election

Question: How many National Assembly seats will the African National Congress (ANC) win in the 2024 South African general election?
Description: All 400 seats in the South Africa National Assembly will be up for a vote in the next general election, which has had an ANC majority since the first post-apartheid election of 1994 (Economist, Voice of America Africa, South African Parliament - National Assembly, Britannica - ANC, Africa News). The general election is expected in or around May 2024, and the close date for this question will be changed once the official election date is set.

Question: Which football (soccer) club will win the 2023-24 UEFA Champions League final?
Description: The 2023-24 UEFA Champions League final is scheduled to be played at Wembley Stadium in London, England, on 1 June 2024 (UEFA, UEFA - Clubs).

Question: What will be the average Air Quality Index value in New Delhi, India, in May 2024?
Description: A report from Swiss air quality technology company IQAir indicated that 83 of the 100 cities with the worst air pollution in the world were in India in 2023 (CNN). The question will be suspended on 30 May 2024 and the outcome determined using data from AirNow once complete data for the month of May 2024 are available (AirNow.gov). To access the resolution data on the site, choose "New Delhi" under "Select a City," click on the "Historical" tab, and download the file for "2024 PM2.5 YTD." Add all positive valid data points for the column titled "AQI" (invalid entries are coded as -999, and valid data points are labeled "Valid" under "QC Name") with a "5" under "Month" and divide the sum by the number of valid data points. Averages in May 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 were, respectively, 164.15, 123.07, 123.84, 158.47, and 129.19. If the named source changes the way it presents the data, we will make the appropriate modifications to the resolution instructions.

Question: Will the adopted EU Artificial Intelligence (AI) Act be published in the Official Journal of the European Union before 25 May 2024?
Description: After years of negotiations between EU institutions and member states, the European Parliament reached a political agreement with the European Council to move the EU AI Act forward toward adoption (European Parliament, The Verge, Politico, European Parliament - Legislative Train Schedule).

Question: When will the leaders of China, Japan, and South Korea next hold a trilateral meeting in person?
Description: While a trilateral meeting between Japan, South Korea, and the US is reportedly planned for July 2024, efforts are reportedly still underway to restart once-regular trilateral meetings between the leaders of China, Japan, and South Korea, though December 2023 came and went despite South Korea having reportedly proposed a meeting for that month (Economist, Global Times, US News & World Report, Deutsche Welle). The location of the meeting is immaterial, so long as all three leaders are in the same room. A meeting held in concert with another event (e.g., G20 summit, state visit) would count so long as a meeting is held with the three leaders among themselves and their own respective entourages. For the purposes of this question, the leaders of Japan and South Korea are the prime minister and president, respectively, and a meeting without either leader would not count. As of the launch of this question, Li Qiang was the incumbent Premier of China, and Xi Jinping was the incumbent President of China. A meeting without either China's premier or president would not count, and a meeting with both China's premier and president would close "and the President of China will represent China."
choices: Before 1 July 2024, and the Premier of China will represent China
Before 1 July 2024, and the President of China will represent China
Between 1 July 2024 and 30 September 2024, and the Premier of China will represent China
Between 1 July 2024 and 30 September 2024, and the President of China will represent China
No meeting will take place before 1 October 2024
target: Before 1 July 2024, and the Premier of China will represent China

Question: Which football (soccer) club will win the 2023-24 UEFA Women's Champions League final?
Description: The 2023-24 UEFA Champions League final is scheduled to be played at San Mamés Stadium in Bilbao, Spain, on 25 May 2024 (UEFA, UEFA - Women's Champions League Clubs). The first quarterfinal matches are scheduled for 19 March 2024 (UEFA - Quarter-finals Draws, Sports Illustrated).

Question: Who will win the special election for California's 20th Congressional District in 2024?
Description: Representative Kevin McCarthy resigned from the House a few months after being ousted as Speaker, creating a vacancy to be filled by a special election scheduled for 21 May 2024 (AP, Bakersfield Californian, Ballotpedia). The nonpartisan primary is scheduled for 19 March 2024 (KGET).

Question: What will be the total value of trade between Australia and China in the first four months of 2024?
Challenges_list: City University of Hong Kong Challenge
Description: As relations between Australia and China have thawed in recent years, trade has increased between the two countries (US News & World Report, Yahoo, Prime Minister of Australia). The question will be suspended on 30 April 2024 and outcome determined using data as reported by China's General Administration of Customs when data for April 2024 are first available (Stats.customs.gov.cn). On the site, 1) set "Flow" to "Import and Export," 2) set "Currency" to "US dollar," 3) set "Period" for the appropriate date ranges, 4) check the "By month" box, 5) set the first "Select" row to "Select partner," 6) enter "601" into the field to the immediate right of "Select partner," and 7) click "Enquiry." Click "Confirm" in the notification box that comes up, then complete the captcha puzzle. For historical data current as of the launch of this question, download: https://goodjudgment.io/docs/Australia_China_Trade_Data_2018-2023YTD_28_November_2023.xlsx. As of the launch of this question, China's General Administration of Customs reported the total value of trade between Australia and China in the first four months of 2023 to be $77.865 billion.
choices: More than $68 billion but less than $74 billion
More than $80 billion but less than $86 billion
target: More than $68 billion but less than $74 billion

Question: Will a member of the LIV Golf League (LIV) win the 2024 PGA Championship?
Description: Saudi Public Investment Fund-backed LIV, founded in 2021, has been a rival to the nearly-century old PGA which generally has not permitted LIV golfers to participate in their events, with some exceptions (Golf Digest, National Club Golfer). The PGA Championship is scheduled for 13-19 May 2024 (PGA Championship). If a merger between LIV and the PGA is completed before the PGA Championship, further instructions will be given depending on the nature of a final agreement (Today's Golfer).

Question: Which team will win the English Premier League for the 2023-24 season?
Description: The Premier League is the highest level of professional soccer (football) in England and Wales (Premier League, Premier League - Standings/Tables). The final matches of the season (Premier League doesn't use a playoff system) are scheduled for 19 May 2024 (Premier League - News).

Question: How far will the Oklahoma City Thunder advance in the 2024 NBA playoffs?
Description: After posting a losing record in the 2022-23 regular season, the Oklahoma City Thunder have surprised many as they fight   to end the regular season at the top of the NBA Western Conference (Yahoo, Sports Illustrated, NBA - Standings). The regular season is scheduled to end on 14 April 2024, followed by the Play-In Tournament 16-19 April 2024, and the NBA Finals scheduled to begin on 6 June 2024 (NBA - 2024 Playoff Schedule).
choices: The Thunder will win the 2024 NBA Finals

Question: Will the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) publish a proposed rule that would reschedule marijuana to Schedule III or lower before 18 May 2024?
Description: The DEA is reportedly "conducting its review" of whether to reschedule marijuana under the Controlled Substances Act, currently designated Schedule I (Axios, Congressional Research Service, Vangst, DEA - Drug Scheduling). The question would close upon the proposed rule's publication in the Federal Register (Federal Register). Rescheduling to "Schedule III or lower" includes Schedules III, IV, V, or outright descheduling. An interim final rule would count.

Question: Will Moody's downgrade its long-term credit rating for the United States before 18 May 2024?
Description: On 10 November 2023, Moody's Investor Service (Moody's) changed its ratings outlook to negative, citing higher interest rates and fiscal deficits (The Hill, CNBC). Moody's, one of the "Big Three" global credit rating agencies that assigns ratings on a borrower's likelihood of repaying its debts, was the only member of the Big Three to have a AAA rating for the US as of the launch of this question (Investopedia, Trading Economics).

Question: Which country or countries will FIFA announce as the host(s) of the 2027 Women’s World Cup?
Description: FIFA is considering three bids from prospective hosts of the 2027 Women's World Cup after South Africa withdrew itself from consideration in November 2023 (Bleacher Report, Just Women's Sports). The FIFA Congress is scheduled to vote on who will host the 2027 World Cup on 17 May 2024 (FIFA). If either a country that was party to a joint bid drops out or a country or countries join an existing bid, their inclusion or absence in the answer option will be immaterial. If FIFA delays the selection of the host, the close date will be adjusted accordingly. If the 2027 Women’s World Cup is canceled for whatever reason before a host is selected, the question will close "Another outcome."

Question: In Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) v. Community Financial Services Association of America, Limited, will the Supreme Court rule that the funding mechanism for the CFPB is unconstitutional?
Description: The CFPB has a unique funding mechanism among US regulatory agencies in that it requires no congressional appropriation of funds and its director determines the bureau's budget (Congressional Research Service). The Fifth Circuit ruled that the mechanism violated the Appropriations Clause of the constitution and separation of powers, which the CFPB appealed to the Supreme Court (Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals, SCOTUSblog, Holland & Knight). The Supreme Court is expected to hand down its decision in its 2023 term, but if it does not, the question will close as "No." If the Court decides this case without addressing this question's particular issue of law, the question will close as "No."

Question: Who will win the Democratic primary for the US Senate election for Maryland in 2024?
Description: The Democratic primary race to replace retiring US Sen. Ben Cardin includes Prince George’s County Executive Angela Alsobrooks and Rep. David Trone, with the winner likely to face Republican former Governor Larry Hogan in the general election (The Hill, Maryland.gov - Primary Candidates). The Democratic primary is scheduled for 14 May 2024 (Ballotpedia).

Question: Which country will win Eurovision 2024?
